story:
Update 1: Hello Siri! Exciting news, you guys have been asking for it and now it’s here. EnJai™ now works with Apple iOS! We’ve looked into making the integration and adjusted the compatibility to work with iPhone models: 3GS, 4, 4S, and the new iPhone 5 running iOS 5 or greater.

We’re thrilled at shenYon to continuously strive to make our products simpler and better for our users, and now by expanding our compatibility with Apple’s iOS we’re one step closer.

Nancy + shenYon Team

For press inquiries, please contact media@shenyon.com

It’s Time To Break Free!...and now it's as easy as Downloading an App for FREE.

EnJai™ is the first ever Dual-Functioning, WIRELESS, WATERPROOF Earbuds. It's completely customizable with our EnJai™ Mobile App. EnJai™ connects to Android devices, such as Smartphones, with our transceiver which easily attaches through the audio jack seamlessly allowing RF waves to connect. While designing EnJai™ both hardware and software, we strove to create a simplistic yet customizable Earbud that would allow you to live the active lifestyle and not have to worry about the nuisance of cords holding you back from your everyday activities. 

CUSTOMIZE WITH EnJai™ MOBILE APP

Our app makes EnJai™ Earbuds even simpler to use. With categories such as Phone, Music, Battery, Voice Recognition & Volume Control there’s nothing you can’t adjust to your preferred settings. Everything is completely CUSTOMIZABLE!

Aside from the obvious adjustments you can make by turning or tapping on your EnJai™ Earbuds to adjust Volume, and ending/receiving calls…you can now customize your settings on your EnJai™ Mobile App. For example, in your phone section, just simply tap on the Phone Icon, which will then direct you to your “Left” & “Right” Earbud settings for EnJai™. Because each individual unit works separately, you choose by selecting which Earbud you’d like to receive Incoming calls from. Options for that could be: left, right, or both! With Outgoing calls you can select either your left or right Earbud to activate the Voice Recognition feature. It’s as easy as one tap.

Not only are you able to make and receive phone calls with EnJai™ you can also listen to your favorite Music. With our “Patent Pending” technology EnJai™ allows you to use its Dual-Functioning Wireless feature by listening to music on one Earbud while taking a call on the other. Simply tap the Music Icon, and decide which Earbud you’d like to listen to Music from: left, right, or both! Once you’ve done that you can also choose to turn the “Fade Out” button on/off. By turning on this feature you choose to fade your music volume out when a call is incoming.

Depending on what your activity is you can navigate through your playlists and continuously listen to your music while Running, Swimming and Biking…you name it, you can do it with EnJai™.

Our Voice Recognition feature let’s you dial anyone by name or number in your contact list by double tapping the top of your EnJai™ Earbuds. Want to play your favorite song without going through your phone? Well, now you can! Just double tap your EnJai™ Earbuds and say “Play Lady Gaga Poker Face”. Without skipping a beat you can multifunction with ease. Other functions of our App include checking your Battery Levels & Volume Controls for each EnJai™ Earbud.

Life’s to enjoyable to be held back by cords. Explore Without Limitations™.

With EnJai™ we've made advances in both form and function that are AMAZINGLY significant and far reaching. We can't think of a product that will revolutionize an entire category and will do it with such customization for users that makes the process simple & fun. 

Transceiver is a little bigger than a US quarter

 

Transceiver (Black) 

 

Transceiver (LIMITED EDITION White) 

 

EnJai Earbuds (Green Option)

 

 

How does it work?

EnJai™ Earbuds connect through RF Waves by a transceiver that attaches to your Android device’s audio jack. Setting up EnJai™ is as easy as downloading our free EnJai™ Mobile App onto your phone. All software updates are wirelessly transmitted to your EnJai™.

Compatibility

Android devices running OS 2.3 and up. Works great with Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich)!

iPhone Models: 3GS, 4, 4S and the new iPhone 5 running iOS 5 and up. 

Unfortunately EnJai™ does not work with Blackberry, Windows Phone 7, or Palm phones at this time.

Where We're At:

I’ve spent over the last 3 years of my life doing Research & Development, and I can finally say we’re ready for EnJai™ to be in everyone’s ears. We have a functioning prototype and it works. It's been extremely important for us at shenYon to make sure we have the best of the best on our team. 

We've enlisted top mechanical engineers to work on our Industrial Design, software developers to give our users the best user experience on Android, and seasoned hardware development consultants that have worked with high profile firms such as IBM, Motorola, and LifeFitness to bring products to market. We've taken the necessary steps to make sure we have a realistic timeline in order to get all the approvals and final production prototypes complete (yes, we need all those approvals before we can ship out to our backers). 

With your support, we can bring EnJai™ Earbuds to the market for the world to enjoy.

Within our development timeframe, we'll be able to do the following: 

-Order the injection molds and production tooling: a huge one-time investment

-Convert our prototypes to production ready models, with all the regulatory and mandated approvals needed

-Place our first production orders (we need to know how many to make, and more is better)

-We are working with manufacturing firm with lots of experience in Consumer Devices, they've manufactured for some of the top Fortune 500 companies to date

Let's Get Started!

Get this product before it hits retail and for a big discount over the $199 retail price. Show your support by selecting any of the pledge levels on the right. Enlist others! Spread the word! The more we can raise, the better and faster we can produce. We thank you for believing in EnJai™.

REWARDS

Each EnJai™ Earbud has three stereo subsystems. Each subsystem includes a control transceiver and two Earbud devices. You'll also receive a special USB cable that recharges the headsets.

$129 - One Jet Black EnJai™

$214 - Two Jet Black EnJai™

$300 - One Silver EnJai™  

$385 - Two Silver EnJai™

$500 - Two EnJai™ in Company Colors (Green or Blue) only to Indiegogo Backers

$1000 – Two LIMITED EDITION White EnJai™ (500 limit) Plus, first look at “Behind the Scenes” documentary.

 

FAQ

Q. How long does the battery last?    A. The rechargeable battery keeps EnJai™ going for 5hrs+ while in use, and a standby of close to 8-10hrs. 

Q. Is it waterproof?    A. EnJai™ Earbuds are water resistant; you can go swimming a full Olympic size pool away from the transceiver as well as fully submerge EnJai™ in water. You can even take your very important calls right in the shower. We're working on getting the certification level to a point where you can go at least 12ft/3.6 Meters deep with them in your ear (IPX58 As defined in International Standard IEC 60529).

Q. How does it charge?    A. We include a special USB cable with our unit box. You can charge EnJai™ using your computer, car charger, or any wall outlet.

Q. What are RF Waves? A. RF Waves stand for Radio Frequency, which is a rate of oscillation that ranges from multiple levels that correspond to the frequency of radio, and their alternating currents which carry radio signals.

Q. Why do you need a transceiver? A. Having the wireless functionality was difficult to achieve in a sense that we needed to generate enough space in a small device that would contain all of the electronics to implement the RF link to the two wireless Earbuds. With Bluetooth it would simply interfere with the ability to have each unit work on it’s own. We didn’t want to run the risk of EnJai™ not syncing properly, and there being a delay in audio.

story:
What Tethercell allows you to do:

- Turn AA-battery-powered devices on and off remotely

- Be alerted when battery power is low

- Set device schedules & timers

- *NEW* Find Tethercell enabled devices with proximity function 

Examples of what Tethercell can be used with...


  

 

 

 

Easy Setup

Tethercell is extremely simple to install. First, remove a single AA-battery from whichever device you choose.  Next, make sure that Tethercell already has a AAA battery installed within it, then replace the removed AA battery with Tethercell. No matter how many AA batteries are required to run the device, you only need one Tethercell. After the Tethercell is snug in the battery compartment, turn on the device, fire up the Tetherboard app after downloading it free from the App store and you're ready to connect from any iOS or Android device that is Bluetooth Smart compatible.

The Tethercell App (for iOS and Android)

You can think of The Tethercell App as your Tethercell control center. From the Tethercell App you can easily connect to and control all active Tethercells in range straight from this intuitive interface which will be freely downloadable for supported devices. Tethercells have been tested to communicate with an iPhone 4S up to 100 feet away in an open field.

iOS

The Tethercell iOS App will be compatible with all Bluetooth Smart-enabled (i.e. Bluetooth 4.0) iOS smartphones and tablets. 

Android

The Tethercell Android App will be compatible with all Bluetooth Smart-enabled (i.e. Bluetooth 4.0) Android smartphones and tablets running Android 4.3 or 4.4. This includes over 160 devices already in the market.

We’re designing Tethercell so that you can connect to a number of Tethercells instantaneously (we've tested up to four at once with good performance). No configuration processes, connections to maintain within your home network or other required hardware components. Once you have the app on your smartphone or tablet you’re ready to go. And since Tethercell only requires your smartphone or tablet for connectivity, connecting to Tethercell on the go is just as easy as connecting at home.

iOS app-screen images

 

Intelligent Design

We believe that a lot of everyday products are begging to be re-examined and re-designed. As design engineers, we initially approached this project as a packaging problem, not too dissimilar from how you'd approach the ground up design of a new rocket engine or launch vehicle. While it may not be rocket science, our team's 20 years of collective experience in that field certainly came in handy during the conceptual and protoytpe design phase of Tethercell.

 

CAD Rendering of Tethercell's internal workings.

 

The Functional Prototypes

To date, we've been through two major prototyping phases (and several design iterations within each phase). The first phase included a Windows-based application that communicated with a Tethercell that was true to the required final product dimensions. The second phase included an iOS application that executed all required control functions (except for the timer and device password functions) as well as a Tethercell that was built to the required final product dimensions.

Current Prototype Details:

  • Preliminary iOS application demonstrating attribute send & receive functionality.
  • SLS outer mechanical shell
  • Consolidated PCB assembly (produced to dimensions required for the final product)
  • Coil spring and stampings

 

Functional Tethercell prototype shown with all internal components.

 

We Need Your Help!

We've spent the last year designing and developing Tethercell and it's accompanying Beta App. We've been through a series of prototypes and now have functional hardware that we're really proud of. However, despite all of our successes with the prototype we now need your help to take Tethercell to the next level. In exchange for your support we want to put the first series of "Beta" Tethercell's into your hands so that you can share your Tethercell user experiences with us. With the valuable feedback we receive from supporters like yourselves, projects like Tethercell will be given the opportunity to evolve and grow in a way we simply couldn't achieve by ourselves.

 

What your contribution will help us do

  • Finalize the App development and electrical board layout.
  • Order parts for the first 5000 units.
  • Order tooling for the mechanical shell and stampings.
  • Obtain FCC and Bluetooth Certifications.

 

Who we are

Experienced engineers

Tetherboard is a passion project started by Trey Madhyastha and Kellan O'Connor, both experienced mechanical design engineers. As veterans of the aerospace industry, both Trey and Kellan drew inspiration from many of the hardware design elements developed during their respective years of service at Space Exploration Technologies (SpaceX) where they designed mechanical and fluid systems for the Falcon 9 rocket. 

Trey and Kellan

 

High Quality Partnerships

We of course could not have done this without the support of our friends, family and a few key partnerships. One partnership in particular was made with Brinton Engineering LLC, a premiere RF and embedded electrical systems R&D shop in Menlo Park, CA. Brinton is providing electrical design and prototyping support for the Tethercell electrical board.

Why We're Doing This

We believe in intelligent design, thinking outside the box and challenging set norms. With that said, we saw an opportunity to innovate around a commodity product that is a part of everyone's life. Yes, many are working to increase the energy density of batteries, while others are developing more efficient rechargeable batteries. With Tethercell we chose to go in a different direction. The result has been a challenging project that has landed us on IndieGoGo for support so that we may take this idea to the next level!

Production and Fulfillment Schedule

One of the many things we've learned as hardware engineers is that things take longer than expected. With this notion in mind, we've carefully thought through our production and delivery schedule and are confident that we can meet all of the project milestones listed below. Developing high-quality hardware, software, and firmware is a time-consuming venture; the milestone dates below are realistic; to suggest anything less would be dishonest, and we prefer to be as upfront about these things as we can possibly be. We will of course keep you posted on our progress.

  • January 2013 – Finalize electrical board layout and add the final set of features to the app.
  • February 2013 – Product and app testing. Order long lead electronics components as well as tooling for the plastic shell.
  • March 2013  – Further product testing and certification (FCC and Bluetooth).
  • April 2013 – Component kit delivery to PCB manufacturer and assembly house.
  • May 2013 – Complete product kits delivered to fulfillment partner for final assembly and packaging.
  • June 2013 – Start shipping the first Tethercells to our earliest backers.

Privacy and Security

Tethercell has been designed with privacy in mind. From the beginning we've included a feature to allow users to enter a personal code in order to connect to Tethercell. In the first functional prototype this feature was called "FAMILY ID." In the second functional prototype, as well as with with the final product, we are using the same underlying functionality, but are calling it "Device Password." In the final version of the app, when a Tethercell is discovered for the first time, the user will be prompted to establish a device password. From there on out no other Tetherboard user will be able to connect to that Tethercell unless they too know the established device password.

Tech Details

Tethercell is the same size and length as a typical AA-battery, which power approximately 60% of primary battery-operated devices. You’ll notice that Tethercell is powered by a AAA battery, which allows room for the embedded intelligence that we’ve packed into a really tight space. Don’t worry - your devices will still have the power they need to function when just one of the AAs is substituted with the AAA-powered Tethercell.  The electronic brains embedded within the Tethercell contains a lot of cutting-edged electronics based upon the TI CC2540 microcontroller. Packed with a current sensing OP-AMP comparator, temperature sensor, N-channel MOSFET (capable of switching up to 5A), 1.5 to 3V boost converter and embeddeded 8051 microcontroller, Tethercell represents a veritable untapped playground of potential.

 

Standard AA battery beside Tethercell Adapter

 

Tethercell will have many user-definable modes of operation. Powering the on-board Bluetooth radio consumes a very small amount of current (~20mA). However, the radio operates on a low duty cycle, meaning that it doesn't transmit for very long and ideally spends most of it's time asleep. Users will be able to tailor the behavior of their Tethercells via the Tetherboard App using simple iOS style App controls. For usage cases requiring simply turning on or off items in use and then going to sleep, the Tethercell's quiescent power consumption enables the device to run for approximately six to twelve months on a single AAA battery. In general, the device has been demonstrated to provide months of reliable use in real world testing. Needless to say, the battery life is highly dependent upon how the device is configured and how much power the host device draws.

Tethercell utilizes Bluetooth 4.0, the new low power Bluetooth protocol that will play a big part in the Internet of Things. With Bluetooth Smart Ready the range of use with Tethercell should extend to about 60 feet through one wall. As stated earlier, we have conducted some open field tests where we demonstrated connectivity at distances over 100 feet. As with any RF device, environment plays a significant role in the performance of Tethercell. We are confident in stating these range figures as we routinely exceed them in testing.

What is Bluetooth Low Energy?

Bluetooth Low Energy, as the name suggests, is the lower energy version of Bluetooth, the popular wireless radio technology. Bluetooth Low Energy was the enabling technology that made Tethercell possible; Bluetooth Low Energy, more commonly referred to as Bluetooth Smart Ready, requires significantly less power for operation than other traditional radio options. This technology will benefit a number of industries as many hardware developers are actively seeking solutions to shrink devices into increasingly smaller form-factors and power those devices for longer periods of time from equally small power sources. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Tethercell uses a AAA battery in place of a AA battery.  How does this affect battery life? 

A: A good quality AAA battery has about 1/2 to 1/3 the capacity of a AA battery.  As a result, the AAA battery will run down first, at which point the app will notify you that it's time to refresh the AAA cell.  Tethercell will cut off the circuit if the AAA battery discharges to such an extent that it could otherwise reverse charge and present a hazard.  After refreshing the AAA cell, the device will continue to operate and the remaining life in the AA cells can be used until they are drained.  Approximately 1/2 of the capacity of the AAA cell is used for the Bluetooth connection for 1 year of quiescent connectivity, leaving the remaining juice for the device it is installed in.  Of course, for high drain devices, you'll probably be changing or recharging the AAA cell well before the 1 year mark. 

Q: Can I use rechargeable batteries with Tethercell?

A: Yes! Tethercell performs best with rechargable cells because of their low internal resistance, especially in high drain devices.  We have tested Tethercell with Sanyo Eneloop XX batteries with exceptional results.  In one test, a AAA cell charged to 1350 mAH capacity; paired with rechargeable AA cells, Tethercell really shines, and the life deficit is easily overcome, gaining you unprecendented functionality.  We recommend NiMH Low Self Discharge cells (like Eneloop) for maximum performance.

Q: Can I recharge my AAA cells while they are installed in Tethercell?

A: Yes!  We have successfully cycled NiMH cells on a La Crosse BC-700 charger multiple times, even at the 700 mAH setting!  Tethercell supports the typical Charge/Discharge-Test/and Charge-Refresh functions common to NiCad and NiMh style chargers.   

Q: Are you planning to make AAA, 9V, and other cell versions in the future?

A: Yes, we have been working on reducing the size of the circuitry to facilitate embedding it in a AAA battery as well as a 9V.  The larger cells are less of a challenge since the electronics present less of a percentage of the available real-estate, and we have a better power budget to work with.

Q:  How did you come up with the idea for Tethercell?

A: Trey, one of the co-founders, struggled with inconveniences associated with the many toys and battery powered devices that made their way into his life once he had kids.  Tethercell was born out of a desire to disable nuisance toys, conveniently enable parental overide for cordless mice, keyboards and the like, turn on a baby monitor without entering his son's room, and finding the TV remotes that seemed to to wander off a little too often when his toddlers took a liking to them.

Q:  Is Tethercell made in the USA?

A:  We are making every effort to manufacture the most critical components of Tethercell close to home to ease logistics.  We received many offers from US based suppliers to help us achieve that goal. 

Q:  Does Tethercell need to have an active BT connection for the timers to work?

A:  No, after setting a timing routine from the Tethercell app, the information is wirelessly communicated to the embedded micro-controler within Tethercell.  Even after a connection is terminated, the programmed timers will continue to function. 

Q:  Will Tethercell work if it's installed in a metallic enclosure device, like a Mag-Lite?

A: Yes and no.  We have tested Tethercell in an aluminum bodied AA sized flashlight.  Although the device will connect, it needs to be in very close proximity to the transmitter (ie. phone or tablet).  Once pared, it unfortunately suffers from very limited range (~ a few feet) because the aluminum impedes the RF transmissions to the antenna on-board Tethercell. 

Q: Will Tethercell work with motorized devices?

A: Yes, Tethercell can switch up to 5A of current, which is sufficient for most motorized devices.  For high drain devices of this sort, we highly recommend using rechargeable chemistry batteries (NiMH or NiCad) as they have low internal resistance and therefore will not cause a noticable drop in performance.  They also are also more economical since the AAA cell does have reduced capacity.

Q:  Does Tethercell let you know when the AA batteries (if installed) are running low?

A: No, Tethercell is only capable of monitoring and reporting the charge status of the AAA cell contained within it.

 

TIME: 5 Clever Gadgets from CES 2013

CNET: Tethercell magically turns AA batteries into Bluetooth devices

Mashable: Silence Annoying Electronics With This Battery Gadget

The Verge: Tethercell lets you control mostly anything with Bluetooth (hands-on)

Golem.de: Die Bluetooth-Batterie-Macher zeigen Tethercell

This includes over 160 devices already in the market.
We’re designing Tethercell so that you can connect to a number of Tethercells instantaneously (we've tested up to four at once with good performance). No configuration processes, connections to maintain within your home network or other required hardware components. Once you have the app on your smartphone or tablet you’re ready to go. And since Tethercell only requires your smartphone or tablet for connectivity, connecting to Tethercell on the go is just as easy as connecting at home.

iOS app-screen images
 
Intelligent Design
We believe that a lot of everyday products are begging to be re-examined and re-designed. As design engineers, we initially approached this project as a packaging problem, not too dissimilar from how you'd approach the ground up design of a new rocket engine or launch vehicle. While it may not be rocket science, our team's 20 years of collective experience in that field certainly came in handy during the conceptual and protoytpe design phase of Tethercell.
 
CAD Rendering of Tethercell's internal workings.
 
The Functional Prototypes
To date, we've been through two major prototyping phases (and several design iterations within each phase). The first phase included a Windows-based application that communicated with a Tethercell that was true to the required final product dimensions. The second phase included an iOS application that executed all required control functions (except for the timer and device password functions) as well as a Tethercell that was built to the required final product dimensions.
Current Prototype Details:


Preliminary iOS application demonstrating attribute send & receive functionality.
SLS outer mechanical shell
Consolidated PCB assembly (produced to dimensions required for the final product)
Coil spring and stampings


 

Functional Tethercell prototype shown with all internal components.
 
We Need Your Help!
We've spent the last year designing and developing Tethercell and it's accompanying Beta App. We've been through a series of prototypes and now have functional hardware that we're really proud of. However, despite all of our successes with the prototype we now need your help to take Tethercell to the next level. In exchange for your support we want to put the first series of "Beta" Tethercell's into your hands so that you can share your Tethercell user experiences with us. With the valuable feedback we receive from supporters like yourselves, projects like Tethercell will be given the opportunity to evolve and grow in a way we simply couldn't achieve by ourselves.
 
What your contribution will help us do

Finalize the App development and electrical board layout.
Order parts for the first 5000 units.
Order tooling for the mechanical shell and stampings.
Obtain FCC and Bluetooth Certifications.

 
Who we are
Experienced engineers
Tetherboard is a passion project started by Trey Madhyastha and Kellan O'Connor, both experienced mechanical design engineers. As veterans of the aerospace industry, both Trey and Kellan drew inspiration from many of the hardware design elements developed during their respective years of service at Space Exploration Technologies (SpaceX) where they designed mechanical and fluid systems for the Falcon 9 rocket. 

Trey and Kellan
 
High Quality Partnerships
We of course could not have done this without the support of our friends, family and a few key partnerships. One partnership in particular was made with Brinton Engineering LLC, a premiere RF and embedded electrical systems R&D shop in Menlo Park, CA. Brinton is providing electrical design and prototyping support for the Tethercell electrical board.
Why We're Doing This
We believe in intelligent design, thinking outside the box and challenging set norms. With that said, we saw an opportunity to innovate around a commodity product that is a part of everyone's life. Yes, many are working to increase the energy density of batteries, while others are developing more efficient rechargeable batteries. With Tethercell we chose to go in a different direction. The result has been a challenging project that has landed us on IndieGoGo for support so that we may take this idea to the next level!
Production and Fulfillment Schedule
One of the many things we've learned as hardware engineers is that things take longer than expected. With this notion in mind, we've carefully thought through our production and delivery schedule and are confident that we can meet all of the project milestones listed below. Developing high-quality hardware, software, and firmware is a time-consuming venture; the milestone dates below are realistic; to suggest anything less would be dishonest, and we prefer to be as upfront about these things as we can possibly be. We will of course keep you posted on our progress.

January 2013 – Finalize electrical board layout and add the final set of features to the app.
February 2013 – Product and app testing. Order long lead electronics components as well as tooling for the plastic shell.
March 2013  – Further product testing and certification (FCC and Bluetooth).
April 2013 – Component kit delivery to PCB manufacturer and assembly house.
May 2013 – Complete product kits delivered to fulfillment partner for final assembly and packaging.
June 2013 – Start shipping the first Tethercells to our earliest backers.

Privacy and Security
Tethercell has been designed with privacy in mind. From the beginning we've included a feature to allow users to enter a personal code in order to connect to Tethercell. In the first functional prototype this feature was called "FAMILY ID." In the second functional prototype, as well as with with the final product, we are using the same underlying functionality, but are calling it "Device Password." In the final version of the app, when a Tethercell is discovered for the first time, the user will be prompted to establish a device password. From there on out no other Tetherboard user will be able to connect to that Tethercell unless they too know the established device password.
Tech Details
Tethercell is the same size and length as a typical AA-battery, which power approximately 60% of primary battery-operated devices. You’ll notice that Tethercell is powered by a AAA battery, which allows room for the embedded intelligence that we’ve packed into a really tight space. Don’t worry - your devices will still have the power they need to function when just one of the AAs is substituted with the AAA-powered Tethercell.  The electronic brains embedded within the Tethercell contains a lot of cutting-edged electronics based upon the TI CC2540 microcontroller. Packed with a current sensing OP-AMP comparator, temperature sensor, N-channel MOSFET (capable of switching up to 5A), 1.5 to 3V boost converter and embeddeded 8051 microcontroller, Tethercell represents a veritable untapped playground of potential.
 

Standard AA battery beside Tethercell Adapter
 
Tethercell will have many user-definable modes of operation. Powering the on-board Bluetooth radio consumes a very small amount of current (~20mA). However, the radio operates on a low duty cycle, meaning that it doesn't transmit for very long and ideally spends most of it's time asleep. Users will be able to tailor the behavior of their Tethercells via the Tetherboard App using simple iOS style App controls. For usage cases requiring simply turning on or off items in use and then going to sleep, the Tethercell's quiescent power consumption enables the device to run for approximately six to twelve months on a single AAA battery. In general, the device has been demonstrated to provide months of reliable use in real world testing. Needless to say, the battery life is highly dependent upon how the device is configured and how much power the host device draws.
Tethercell utilizes Bluetooth 4.0, the new low power Bluetooth protocol that will play a big part in the Internet of Things. With Bluetooth Smart Ready the range of use with Tethercell should extend to about 60 feet through one wall. As stated earlier, we have conducted some open field tests where we demonstrated connectivity at distances over 100 feet. As with any RF device, environment plays a significant role in the performance of Tethercell. We are confident in stating these range figures as we routinely exceed them in testing.
What is Bluetooth Low Energy?
Bluetooth Low Energy, as the name suggests, is the lower energy version of Bluetooth, the popular wireless radio technology. Bluetooth Low Energy was the enabling technology that made Tethercell possible; Bluetooth Low Energy, more commonly referred to as Bluetooth Smart Ready, requires significantly less power for operation than other traditional radio options. This technology will benefit a number of industries as many hardware developers are actively seeking solutions to shrink devices into increasingly smaller form-factors and power those devices for longer periods of time from equally small power sources. 
Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Tethercell uses a AAA battery in place of a AA battery.  How does this affect battery life? 
A: A good quality AAA battery has about 1/2 to 1/3 the capacity of a AA battery.  As a result, the AAA battery will run down first, at which point the app will notify you that it's time to refresh the AAA cell.  Tethercell will cut off the circuit if the AAA battery discharges to such an extent that it could otherwise reverse charge and present a hazard.  After refreshing the AAA cell, the device will continue to operate and the remaining life in the AA cells can be used until they are drained.  Approximately 1/2 of the capacity of the AAA cell is used for the Bluetooth connection for 1 year of quiescent connectivity, leaving the remaining juice for the device it is installed in.  Of course, for high drain devices, you'll probably be changing or recharging the AAA cell well before the 1 year mark. 
Q: Can I use rechargeable batteries with Tethercell?
A: Yes! Tethercell performs best with rechargable cells because of their low internal resistance, especially in high drain devices.  We have tested Tethercell with Sanyo Eneloop XX batteries with exceptional results.  In one test, a AAA cell charged to 1350 mAH capacity; paired with rechargeable AA cells, Tethercell really shines, and the life deficit is easily overcome, gaining you unprecendented functionality.  We recommend NiMH Low Self Discharge cells (like Eneloop) for maximum performance.
Q: Can I recharge my AAA cells while they are installed in Tethercell?
A: Yes!  We have successfully cycled NiMH cells on a La Crosse BC-700 charger multiple times, even at the 700 mAH setting!  Tethercell supports the typical Charge/Discharge-Test/and Charge-Refresh functions common to NiCad and NiMh style chargers.   
Q: Are you planning to make AAA, 9V, and other cell versions in the future?
A: Yes, we have been working on reducing the size of the circuitry to facilitate embedding it in a AAA battery as well as a 9V.  The larger cells are less of a challenge since the electronics present less of a percentage of the available real-estate, and we have a better power budget to work with.
Q:  How did you come up with the idea for Tethercell?
A: Trey, one of the co-founders, struggled with inconveniences associated with the many toys and battery powered devices that made their way into his life once he had kids.  Tethercell was born out of a desire to disable nuisance toys, conveniently enable parental overide for cordless mice, keyboards and the like, turn on a baby monitor without entering his son's room, and finding the TV remotes that seemed to to wander off a little too often when his toddlers took a liking to them.
Q:  Is Tethercell made in the USA?
A:  We are making every effort to manufacture the most critical components of Tethercell close to home to ease logistics.  We received many offers from US based suppliers to help us achieve that goal. 
Q:  Does Tethercell need to have an active BT connection for the timers to work?
A:  No, after setting a timing routine from the Tethercell app, the information is wirelessly communicated to the embedded micro-controler within Tethercell.  Even after a connection is terminated, the programmed timers will continue to function. 
Q:  Will Tethercell work if it's installed in a metallic enclosure device, like a Mag-Lite?
A: Yes and no.  We have tested Tethercell in an aluminum bodied AA sized flashlight.  Although the device will connect, it needs to be in very close proximity to the transmitter (ie. phone or tablet).  Once pared, it unfortunately suffers from very limited range (~ a few feet) because the aluminum impedes the RF transmissions to the antenna on-board Tethercell. 
Q: Will Tethercell work with motorized devices?
A: Yes, Tethercell can switch up to 5A of current, which is sufficient for most motorized devices.  For high drain devices of this sort, we highly recommend using rechargeable chemistry batteries (NiMH or NiCad) as they have low internal resistance and therefore will not cause a noticable drop in performance.  They also are also more economical since the AAA cell does have reduced capacity.
Q:  Does Tethercell let you know when the AA batteries (if installed) are running low?
A: No, Tethercell is only capable of monitoring and reporting the charge status of the AAA cell contained within it.
 
TIME: 5 Clever Gadgets from CES 2013
CNET: Tethercell magically turns AA batteries into Bluetooth devices
Mashable: Silence Annoying Electronics With This Battery Gadget
The Verge: Tethercell lets you control mostly anything with Bluetooth (hands-on)
Golem.de: Die Bluetooth-Batterie-Macher zeigen Tethercell

story:
Have you ever been running and wished your earphones would just stay in your ears? Do you ride a motorcycle and struggle to keep your earphones or earplugs in when wearing a helmet? Do you find that your earphones hurt your ears after a while? Earcandi is a reusable, silicone based polymer that moulds around your earphones giving you a customised fit and ensures that they stay in your ears - 100% guaranteed, no matter what. Earcandi was born out of a desire for functional sports earphones that don't fall out or dislodge when engaging in physical activity. We have developed a solution to the problem of earphones falling out for when you need to focus on your sport and not mess around putting your earbuds back in your ears every 5 minutes.

Essentially, anything generic that fits in the ear can be customised with Earcandi. Because your ear shape is as unique as your fingerprint there is no ,'one size fits all' option that works fully. The cool thing about Earcandi is that in the same way as we are customising our phones with apps and printing stuff on our desktop in 3D, it's now possible to get away from the uncomfortable generic earphones with poor functionality and upgrade to something blueprinted exactly for you.

Colours of Earcandi are available to Indiegogo supporters are as follows:

Purple, blue, green, yellow, orange, pink, black and white.

Sennheiser CX400 earphones are available in Black or white.

 

 

Well, it's pretty simple. Earcandi kind of looks like play-doh, but you get a white part and a coloured part. Take the two parts out of their respective packaging and mix them together for about a minute - this sets in motion the curing process. Insert your earphones into your ears, split the resulting mix in two and just push it in around your earphones (or just in your ears for earplugs). Leave it for ten minutes to set, take them out and voila, Earcandi custom moulded earphones!

The medical grade silicone polymer we use produces a soft, flexible and durable product which you can leave in your ears for hours without noticing. Noise isolation is greatly improved due to the exact fit you get with Earcandi, allowing you to play your music at lower volumes which reduces the chance of damaging your hearing by having to crank up the volume. For this reason audiologists will all emphasize there is no substitute for custom earphones. The silicone easily bonds to any earphones and will retain its shape permanently, giving you a soft, sturdy and comfortable set of custom earphones that will last.

Regular custom moulded earphones/monitors have been around for a while now, but for the majority of people they are prohibitively expensive. Earcandi are the first of their kind and solve the problem of cost by cutting out expensive elements of production such as visits to specialists for ear castings and injection moulding systems.We think we've struck a good balance with the Earcandi system - better than the 'one size fits all' approach of regular earbuds, but a fraction of the cost of expensive in-ear monitors.

 

 

 

Although sport is a huge part of our market, it isn't the only application for Earcandi and our unique Sonicone material can be used for a variety of other things as well. The secure, low profile fit ensures that when wearing a helmet for motorsport or motorcycle riding, you earphones will stay in even when the rumble strips and potholes are rattling out your fillings. You can also say goodbye to windrush as the perfect fit you get with Earcandi make this a thing of the past.

Musicians can also benefit from a custom fit for on stage in-ear monitors. Because they are moulded easily in only ten minutes at home, they are ten to one hundred times cheaper than the prohibitively expensive custom monitors professional musicians use.

In addition to this, Earcandi can be used without earphones to make custom moulded earplugs for anything from surfing to blocking out noise from the habitual snorer lying next to you. Earcandi particularly suits people who have trouble sleeping as the custom fit ensures that they are incredibly comfortable when lying down whilst providing excellent noise reduction.

 

 


Hi, We're Lloyd and Steve - the guys behind earcandi. We're both pretty active people and participate in quite a few different sports - running, cycling, mountain biking, triathlon, snowboarding, climbing and kickboxing to name a few. Like many people we knew, we were completely fed up of our earphones constantly falling out whenever we did any kind of sport. Between us we'd tried all of the sports-fit styles, ear-buds and even these weird little cone things, (which either fell out or hurt our ears after about 10 minutes). We'd pretty much given up on being able to listen to music when we were moving around with any kind of intensity until Lloyd started messing around with a squidgy wax earplug whilst on holiday in Norway. Fast forward past Steve's kitchen, combining stinky bathroom sealant and various other bits and bobs and we hooked up with a medical silicone manufacturer who helped us formulate a much safer, softer and more colourful version of the original, smelly prototype. To this day, the first pair moulded have never fallen out, no matter what, not once - and we reckon that's pretty good going considering how often we find ourselves upside down when we should be the right way up. We're a young company trying to find our feet in the world of business, (the jeans and hoodies get some odd looks at meetings), but we reckon if we can do what we do well, offer our product at a reasonable price and look after and listen to our customers we should be alright. The feedback we have received on the product so far has been fantastic and the journey has been loads of fun, we're looking forward to seeing what's in store for the future and hope you join us for the ride...

Cheers,

Lloyd and Steve :)

 

At the moment we are in the process of building the website and designing packaging, logos and creating videos. As fun and challenging as this is, it all costs money - and we're running out! The companies we have been working with have been great and a some have such faith in the product that they are willing to accept payment further down the line, once we are into production. This has been a massive help and consolidates our opinion that Earcandi is a genuinely good idea. With a relatively small boost from the Indiegogo campaign we'll be able to source the raw materials we need and pay the packaging manufacturer to move us into full scale production.

 

 

We've been working on Earcandi for almost a year and had initially intended to launch in November 2013. We held back so that we could ensure the prototype formulation worked perfectly and so that we could speak to more factories to ensure they could cope with a potentially huge ramp-up in production. Comfortable that we can deliver this, we’re now launching Earcandi!

Below are a couple of the main challenges we will tackle:

Choice of Factory: As with any physical item there are a number of challenges to getting it right. We have been part of numerous projects that have made it through development, into the factory production phase, and then into consumer hands. While our experiences have helped prepare us to avoid major pitfalls, we have been very selective in our choice of factory, choosing a partner that we know we can work with and that is perfect for our needs. They are large enough to scale Earcandi, but without being so big that we'll be lost amidst the shop floor, and they have a great development team. We also intend to spend a large amount of time in person at the factory.

Quality Control: Good QC is a major focus of ours. The quantity of orders on Indiegogo will help determine how we handle this. If we receive orders for under 1000 units, we will batch test ourselves at Earcandi HQ in Brighton. If we receive over 1000 orders we will carry out all QC in-situ at the factory, with the assistance of dedicated QC personnel.

This is about getting the best possible product into your hands ASAP. So please take a look at the rewards and pledge now.

Thanks!

 

Colours of Earcandi available to Indiegogo supporters are as follows:

Purple, blue, green, yellow, orange, pink, black and white.

Sennheiser CX400 earphones available in Black or white.

story:
Short Summary

Take part in creating the future of calculations and functional programming by supporting Il Calculus project! Be an early adopter of Il Calculus and use all its future features for free!

Il Calculus (implicit lambda calculus) is a functional programming language based on lambda calculus, but with syntax similar to the secondary school algebra course syntax. It is a programming language with the largest potential user base in the world.

About this app:

  • You can use Il Calculus app to do mathematical calculations for various purposes – studies, research, work…
  • Il Calculus app allows users to define their own functions (buttons), to reuse the existing ones and in next version it will be available to share your personalized functions with others. App is user friendly – everything can be done in one main screen by using drag&drop feature on the touch screen.
  • The basic app is free. The first version for Windows Phone 8 is available here.
With your help we will:
  • Add cycle construction support to Il Calculus.
  • Develop horizontal (advanced) keyboard layouts for mobile apps.
  • Besides Windows Phone 8, we will develop Android, Windows 8 and IPhone apps.
  • Add cloud hosting support and possibility to share functions with others.

What We Need & What You Get

  • First, we need 4000 $ to improve Il Calculus (add cycle construction support, data structure support and other features) and to develop horizontal keyboard layouts (one for working with different counting systems and other for advanced calculations).
  • Second, we need 2000 $ to add Android support.
  • Third, we need 4000 $ to add IPhone support. Development hardware and related training costs are included in this goal.

Many perks are related to other perks. You can interpret "previous" as nonterminal expression. For example: "secret society + previous" = "secret society" + "resalable license + previous" = "secret society" + "resalable license" + "thanks".

We advise you to choose perks with our technology licenses. If you want to be active and participate in conquering the world of calculations, the most suitable perk for you would be with "secret society" included. If you are programmer, you will benefit from perk with Il Calculus source code repository access. But if you are member of a larger society interested in the future programming technologies, our lecture would be your best choice!

  1. Even if we will not reach the goal, we are capable to deliver Windows Phone 8, Android and Windows 8 apps during the summer.
  2. To be able to deliver IPhone app till the end of summer 2014, we need to reach at least 10000 $ goal.

The Impact

Syntax for functional programming basis - lambda calculus can be significantly improved by introducing implicit parameters. We have already finished the largest part of planned research in this field. You can access our publications here and here.

Il Calculus as a programming language allows defining new functions and reusing the existing ones. Il Calculus can be easily integrated into other platforms as an abstract language for doing calculations. Just imagine – you have one language for doing calculations in any platform.

After finishing Il Calculus mobile apps we intend to find a way to cooperate with the software development tool vendors in order to test the suitability of our innovations for the general purpose programming languages. Our innovations will raise code readability. Programmers may spend even 80% of their time on reading other programmers’ code, therefore improving code readability is the best way to raise productivity of programmers.

Making programmers lives easier, our platform will attract programmers attention and get more free content (functions) developed and shared with others.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are interested in your opinion and would like to thank you for your time and effort.

If you:

  • review any of our publications here or here,
  • publish your review in some social network or other relevant web site,
  • during this campaign send us (info@logicsresearchcentre.com) a static link to your review

we will give you:

  • access to Il Calculus repository,
  • Il Calculus single user commercial license,
  • include you in Il Calculus „secret society”.
This project is created by Logics Research Centre.

Add cycle construction support to Il Calculus.
Develop horizontal (advanced) keyboard layouts for mobile apps.
Besides Windows Phone 8, we will develop Android, Windows 8 and IPhone apps.
Add cloud hosting support and possibility to share functions with others.

What We Need & What You Get
First, we need 4000 $ to improve Il Calculus (add cycle construction support, data structure support and other features) and to develop horizontal keyboard layouts (one for working with different counting systems and other for advanced calculations).
Second, we need 2000 $ to add Android support.
Third, we need 4000 $ to add IPhone support. Development hardware and related training costs are included in this goal.
Many perks are related to other perks. You can interpret "previous" as nonterminal expression. For example: "secret society + previous" = "secret society" + "resalable license + previous" = "secret society" + "resalable license" + "thanks".We advise you to choose perks with our technology licenses. If you want to be active and participate in conquering the world of calculations, the most suitable perk for you would be with "secret society" included. If you are programmer, you will benefit from perk with Il Calculus source code repository access. But if you are member of a larger society interested in the future programming technologies, our lecture would be your best choice!
Even if we will not reach the goal, we are capable to deliver Windows Phone 8, Android and Windows 8 apps during the summer.
To be able to deliver IPhone app till the end of summer 2014, we need to reach at least 10000 $ goal.

The ImpactSyntax for functional programming basis - lambda calculus can be significantly improved by introducing implicit parameters. We have already finished the largest part of planned research in this field. You can access our publications here and here. Il Calculus as a programming language allows defining new functions and reusing the existing ones. Il Calculus can be easily integrated into other platforms as an abstract language for doing calculations. Just imagine – you have one language for doing calculations in any platform.After finishing Il Calculus mobile apps we intend to find a way to cooperate with the software development tool vendors in order to test the suitability of our innovations for the general purpose programming languages. Our innovations will raise code readability. Programmers may spend even 80% of their time on reading other programmers’ code, therefore improving code readability is the best way to raise productivity of programmers.Making programmers lives easier, our platform will attract programmers attention and get more free content (functions) developed and shared with others.Other Ways You Can Help
We are interested in your opinion and would like to thank you for your time and effort.If you:

review any of our publications here or here,
publish your review in some social network or other relevant web site,
during this campaign send us (info@logicsresearchcentre.com) a static link to your review
we will give you:

access to Il Calculus repository,
Il Calculus single user commercial license,
include you in Il Calculus „secret society”.
This project is created by Logics Research Centre.

story:
>We all run out of space on our Macbooks and Ultrabooks. 

Adding extra storage is costly and impractical. 

The solution is now here.


  • Add up to 200GB or the highest amount your computer supports
  • A sleek clean design with a Anodized Aluminum finish
  • Universal fit for all Macbooks and Ultrabooks


Yes, something similar does already exist in the market but it is extremely overpriced and not very compatible. 


Infinity is very simplistic product. To put it clearly, it’s used as a middle-man to link a micro SD-card to the SD-card reader on laptops. The major reform is the minimalistic form factor, as opposed to traditional SD cards, which stick out a fair bit from the reader. The simplicity behind Infinity is definitely not worth the $20+ that other products are charging. By utilizing our connections with key over-sea partners, we are able to create a low-cost memory expander for most laptops. The major setback we faced was the inability of the manufacturer to achieve high quality coating on the device, while keeping the costs low. After many long nights, we finally came up with the solution to this problem. We are going to coat the cards right here in Canada. Although the process is tedious and tiresome, we are proud to create jobs for the local community while still getting the achieving the same end result. 



The goal is low because we have put in a lot of our time and money already into this project to make it possible. We need this next final funding for the small stuff like packaging, final development and website completion. In addition to this, we want EVERYONE to have an Infinity. Back us and you won’t be disappointed!

story:
Penzai is a different kind of social platform

Imagine being part of a network where your own websites
can be hooked right into the conversation

a hybrid of website building, content hosting, and social networking

geared toward you and your creations

Image • drawings, renderings, and photos
Video • clips, shows, and films
Writing • stories, essays, and articles
Audio • music and podcasts
Game • embedded and downloadable games

What's Going On

Penzai is the joint effort of a team of community managers with years of experience in a multitude of online groups. We have found a few troubling trends across the board:

  • Large websites today, including social media and galleries, tend to limit their scope and often expect creators to use specialized tools to cross-promote their work.
  • Website builders and blog platforms give people options for design but not often for interaction with their audience.
  • Social media sites have been slow to respond to waves of harassment and other negativity.

The result of our response to these issues is a twofold online platform for creators and fans: a network of full-on websites and a central social hub linking them together.

These sites are built and run by you!

Not only will it be more than just another blog platform, but it can be the spark of whole new networks, each with their own sites, and all tapping into the same pool of users and features!

On top of that, we'll also have:

  • Multilingual support on every page!
  • Forum boards included optionally with every site!
  • Tools to integrate posting to any site with a reasonable API. This is Web 3.0 now, which means that those sites without one soon will be left in the dust!
  • Friendly OpenID and other API interfaces, so you can link your own self-hosted site to Penzai with ease!
  • Native support for semantics using Schema and OpenGraph, so that every post you make public on any Penzai site will get the benefit of instant inclusion and exposure!
  • Simple and smart content tags that let you easily custom-tailor your browsing experience!
  • Individual subscription handling per gallery, so you can have the benefits of donation tiers without leaving your dashboard or dealing with the stigma of paywall!

Finally, we're going to start setting precedents for online communities in the future. Since this is a brand new site in the works, the terms we set are going to be even more important to establish early on. We'll be working with a number of colleagues to find the perfect balance of core community guidelines, and keep the needs of all of you in mind as Penzai grows.

Why Penzai

Penzai (盆栽, "tray plant") is one of two Chinese terms for the crafting of miniature trees and landscapes. Western culture is familiar with the Japanese bonsai, which descended from the original.

We chose it for a few related reasons.

Firstly, we've found that building a channel or gallery is like tending to one of these mini-gardens. It takes hard work, dedication, and an eye for beauty. And of course, you shouldn't stop at just one!

Secondly, we've made light of the "pen" side of things. Every creation you make is an art, and pens factor in a lot when you're signing things.

What We Need

Our ambitious project isn't going to come cheap.

  • Our first priority is hiring a professional web designer to finalize the look of our main site. That way, you can get to see for yourself what the plans will look like in action!
  • Second, we hope to grow pretty quickly! So we'll need to make sure that our hosting is top-notch and ready to handle everything you've got.
  • Third on the list is bringing on full-time staff! With high growth, it'll mean that we can keep up with all the questions you have, add on new features by request, and help keep out the weeds.

Our Risks

Of course, these are all big promises, aren't they? Big enough to be formidable, but small enough that quite a bit of competition could come from this. However, we have a few secret weapons at our disposal.

  • All of our co-founders are established community managers with a combined 20 years of experience.
  • We have early support from over 25 partner groups across multiple communities!
  • Our framework will be made with open-source technologies and made public for widespread access.
  • Maintenance costs will be low, so don't expect us to nickle-and-dime you anytime soon.

What You'll Get

Now, let's talk about what you'll be able to get with this!

  • For every donation, we'll list you on our massive Wall of Founders, which lets you immortalize your name as part of our legacy!
  • We'll be sharing all kinds of early progress on the site as it's built, and with donations as little as $5, you'll be able to take a peek.
  • Top payers will be able to unlock their full potential, being able to launch their own networks right away with lifetime access to the entire Penzai platform!
  • Even if we don't reach our highball goal, our subscription program will continue these perks for you well into the future.

What This Means

Our founders are already familiar with how quickly a community can come together for a common cause. But this project could very well prove to shake the foundations of what we see online!

  • Your presence online will actually mean something!
  • We'll be able to continue helping out struggling creators across the web, and our efforts might even reach you!
  • No longer will you have to settle for less on your profiles!
  • Together we'll be able to give the Web at large a much-needed improvement!

How You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute money to this, there are plenty of ways you can help out!

  • Spread the word out to your friends!
  • Call on your favorite artists, musicians, writers, gamers, developers, or any other idols! Let them know Penzai is coming, and pledge to join if they make a new community home on it!
  • If you're a creative genius, come chat with us on Facebook, Twitter, or even through email! We'd love to discuss the best ways Penzai can suit your needs.
  • Petition your favorite websites. Make sure they have the means to cross-post. With or without Penzai, let's save you the trouble of sharing your best work across the web!
  • Be sure to take advantage of the share tools provided on this page. A few clicks here might save you several more in the future!

Together, we're going to reinvent what it means to be a creator.

It starts today, and it starts with you!

story:
UPDATE:

Hurrican Isaac reminds us all of the urgency for backup power during an emergency.  Help us put mobile power where people need it most.

What's a Crisis Mapper?  

During emergencies, natural disasters, in conflict zones or other crises, people on the scene need charged phones to tell the world what's going on.  Crisis Mappers tweet & text in real time from crisis areas to create maps which emergency responders use to target help to those most in need.   Get more info on crisis mapping here.

Crisis mapping is often most valuable where there is no reliable electrical grid to power mobile phones, where at risk populations are most vulnerable, and powered mobile phones could save lives.  Over half a billion mobile phone users worldwide live completely off the grid, and another three-quarters of a billion people struggle to find reliable electricity.  

Ok...let's keep them connected.

Tremont Electric will partner with CrisisMappers.net to identify people off the grid in developing nations with the most extreme and urgent needs for mobile power.  With help from Indiegogo, we'll fill that need with the nPower® PEG.

The nPower® PEG is the world's first passive kinetic energy charger for personal hand-held devices. Placed in a bag, tied to a belt, mounted on a motorcycle, or hanging from an animal, the nPower® PEG harnesses the kinetic energy of walking, running, jogging, hiking, storing it for use when you need it most - off the grid. The patented nPower® PEG placed second at the 2010 Consumer Electronics Show i-Stage competition for innovation, and won the 2012 Edison Award Silver Medal for Power Generation. Here's a video of the nPower® PEG at work on a SXSW Startup bus.  This June, SmartPlanet called the nPower® PEG the "best charging device ever." 

What's a crisis map look like?  

Here's an example - a crisis map put together by journalists in Kenya. 

You can click on the various spots on the map for details from the reports delivered through mobile devices.  Our project will produce similar maps, but from the clean kinetic energy of the reporters themselves.  Groups receiving PEGs will run simulated crisis mapping incidents, resulting in an online map thick with data that backers can watch grow.

So who are you guys?

Tremont Electric is a Triple Bottom Line Green Plus certified clean energy startup in Cleveland, Ohio, makers of the nPower® PEG, dedicated to making kinetic energy a part of the clean energy future for us all.  Here's the Tremont Electric team - our founder, and inventor of the nPower® technology, Aaron LeMieux, and his wife, VP of Marketing Jill LeMieux, are in the above video.  The International Network of Crisis Mappers is the largest and most active international community of observers, policymakers, journalists, scholars, hackers and skilled volunteers engaged at the intersection between humanitarian crises, technology and crisis mapping.  Jen Ziemke, who's also in the video, is a co-founder of CrisisMappers.net.

I can't wait to watch this project grow online! Where will the mobile power go?

If we reach our goal, 100 nPower® PEG mobile chargers will be hand-delivered to Crisis Mapper projects in high-risk populations off the grid, so they can report, map, record, and observe, powered by their own kinetic energy.  CrisisMappers.net has reached out to its network of over 4000 people worldwide to identify an initial group of projects off the grid that need mobile power.  Here are some sample requests for nPower® PEGs technology, that will be used to help power projects as diverse as:

  • Food security in Sudan & South Sudan
  • Studying health care patterns in Haiti
  • Monitoring nutrition in rural Uganda
  • Tracking nomadic at-risk populations in Darfur

If the IndieGoGo community exceeds our goal, we will continue to work with The International Network of Crisis Mappers to identify more projects that need mobile power, and send them more PEGs.  

Budget - the more raised, the more people get mobile power

The minimum budget for our project is $40,000, which breaks down pretty simple.  100 PEGs cost $17,000.  Shipping, travel, logistics and training for delivery of PEGs to 4 separate projects in 4 separate countries will be minimum $5,000 per trip, x4 = $20,000.  The subtotal is $37,000, and adding Indiegogo fees brings us to $40,000.  Once the PEGs are in place, Crisis Mappers will use crowdsourcing software already in place to create the map that we can all follow as it grows. That's it!  

If we raise more than our goal, more crisis mappers will get mobile power.  Simple as that.

Perks - Watch the crisis maps grow online. Plus T-shirts, PEG pics from the field, or your own PEG!

ALL BACKERS, starting at the $10 level, will be notified by email when the FIRST project goes live online, so you can watch the resulting kinetic energy powered crisis map in real time from your laptop, tablet, or phone. All backers also receive photos from delivery of nPower® PEGs to the field.

At $25, you'll be notified when ALL field tests go live, so you can decide which kinetic energy powered crisis map to watch online. You'll also receive a photo, nPower® sticker, and an nPower® magnet.

At $100, you'll receive all of the items above, plus a limited edition nPower® PEG t-shirt.

At $250, you are fully funding one nPower® PEG for a crisis mapper, including the shipping & delivery, plus you get all the other stuff - t-shirt, sticker, photo, magnet, notifications.

At $500, you get your own nPower® PEG, including shipping to you, so you can charge your devices off the grid, too. The rest goes to fund and deliver a PEG to a crisis mapper, plus you get all the other stuff - t-shirt, sticker, photo, magnet, notifications.

Let's power some Crisis Mappers.

story:
Are you sick of always losing your Bluetooth headset? Or maybe always losing the charger to your headset? PowerCliq is a new iPhone 6 case that solves these problems.

PowerCliq is the first iPhone 6 case that not only charges your Bluetooth headset, but also holds it in the same case as your phone! You will never again have to worry about losing either your headset or the charger.


The PowerCliq is the most convenient case you will ever own. With a fully-integrated Bluetooth 4.0 headset that literally "clicks" into the 2700mAh battery charging case, PowerCliq ensures your phone and headset are always charged and ready to go. To answer a call, simply click the headset out of the case. It's as easy as, "Hello."

The Smart Charge app determines when it's best to charge your phone and case, protecting them both from overcharging.




Frequently Asked Questions:

Have a question that isn't answered here? Email us at info@yasarcorp.com

story:
Bitbrick is a Smartband with Entertainment, Social and Fitness Features.

Flick to play, forward, pause and control the volume of your music while running, walking, hiking and cycling even when your hands are busy with only one flick of the wrist.

Catch the best moments with your Smartphone, include all your friends up to te feet away and take hands-free selfies.

Bitbrick Band allows you to control your PowerPoint or Keynote presentations with simple hand gesture up to eight meters from the screen.

Identify who is calling you and if you are busy you can respond with an SMS automatically with a hand gesture.

Bitbrick has integrated notifications from Facebook.

Egometer which tells you how popular you are at the moment.

Share your emotions on Facebook with a simple gesture: I feel happy, excited or in Love.

Know how active you are. Receive an alert after a long period of inactivity. Keep moving!

Be creative, Bitbrick Band incorporates a gesture engine which will remotely control your Smartphone, Tablet, PC, Smart TV or compatible Smart Devices; you can answer a call or request an auto reply to incoming messages with a gesture, control your applications, games and other devices among endless possibilities.

Bitbrick Band is your sidekick in moments of excitement, joy and humor in life. Take incredible selfies to impress your friends and loved ones. It is an innovative gadget but it is also a powerful tool that boosts your creativity while working.

Bitbrick Band monitors a variety of physical activities, calculates steps, calories burned, distance, and performance and customize your training on-the-go. Imagine you go running in the park at a great pace, this is your best score and want to put your Power Song, with a simple movement of your wrist you can get it.

Bitbrick Band alerts you when you've been inactive for a long time and also when you've reached your goals, break your own records or your friend’s.

Bitbrick Band is a modern lifestyle in which you are always connected no matter if you’re on the move. With your talent and Bitbrick Band you can build a better world, your world.

SPECS

Water resistance: According to the IPX5, able to withstand the daily shower.

Operating temperature: -20 to 45°C

Compatibility: iOS and Android Devices

Range: 7 m

Sensors: Accelerometer

Signaling:Vibrator,Buzzer, Led RGB

Battery and power:

  • Duration: 5 days

  • Type: Lithium polymer

  • AverageLoadTime: 3hrs

  • Charger: USBCharging Station

Materials: Flexible  hypoallergenic elastomer.

Including:

  • BitBrick Band

  • Charging Station

TEAM

RICARDO ARRIAGA (CEO)

Communications and electronics engineer with 15 years’ experience in Information Technology, 10 years of experience as CEO of Ironbit achieving 30% yearly growth. Making the company a "Leader" in Mexico.

ISAAC FARCA (VP Sales)

Communications and electronics engineer with 15 years’ experience in Information Technology, Founder and Commercial Director at Ironbit achieving 30% yearly growth.

FRANCISCO MARTÍNEZ (CSO)

Systems Engineer with 10 years’ experience in Information Technology, part of IBM, Novell, HP and Samsung, vast experience in B2B. Innovative, customer-focused technology sales executive with extensive experience in creating and implementing successful sales strategies, global partnerships and top-producing sales teams.

ERICK RIVERA (CTO)

B. Eng. Electronics and Telecomm (UAEH-2007) and M.Sc. in Electronics (INAOE-2011) with over 9 years of embedded systems experience has developed several technologies in the fields of biosignal and medical image processing, sensor fusion algorithms and machine learning. 

JORGE CANO (ENGINEERING MANAGER)

Communications and electronics engineer, project coordinator and manager of the engineering department at the center of research and development COATL, 8 years’ experience in hardware design focused on wireless, enthusiast and promoter of the Internet of Things technologies.

ADÁN CORONA (DESIGNER)

Industrial designer, design specialist technological products pioneered Wearables and wizard.

ROADMAP

We have been working for two years and now we are ready to launch this unique wristband. We are very lucky to have support of the Mexican Ministry of Science and Technology (CONACYT), the US-Mexico Foundation for Science (FUMEC) and Mexican Ministry of Promotion (PROMEXICO).

We are happy to have a Partnership with a major European Hardware manufacturer company, so this wristband will be made in Netherlands.

Thanks to supporters we could start the process of manufacturing, certification of Hardware, development final versions of Mobile Apps (iOS and Android), API to developers and manufacturing the first batch of Bitbrick Bands.

More than 300 Selfies taken with Bitbrick Band at CES 2015

story:
Please Visit: https://WWW.ROBOQI.COM

 

Introducing ROBOQI 1.0

ROBOQI wireless charging mount delivers optimal charging that is up to 40% faster than other wireless chargers. Our charger detects the exact voltage and current that your phone needs and delivers efficient charging while on the go or at home. Spend less time waiting for your phone to charge when you use our wireless charging mount. ROBOQI is Qi-certified and supports the latest Qi wireless charging version, including 7.5W high speed wireless charging for the iPhones as well as 10W high speed wireless charging for the Android devices. (Please Note: 10W/7.5W fast-charging can ONLY be supported with a QC 3.0 adapter and a 2A USB Cable).

Flawless Detection Insta-Detect Sensor

Mounting your phone is simple and easy. Simply place your phone in the mount ensuring that your phone touches the insta-detect sensor that’s located below the charging disc. Depressing the sensor triggers the robotic arms to close and hold your phone snugly. Once the arms have clasped your phone, simply rotate on the universal rotary ball to achieve the perfect view. To remove your phone, simply lift your phone away from the a insta-detect sensor below the charging disc. The sensor will detect that there is no contact any longer and the robotic arms will release your phone.

Qi-Certified 10W Fast Wireless Charge

WPC Qi Certification

This go everywhere mount is designed to make charging and using your phone a breeze. Whether you want to watch movies on your desktop or use your phone’s GPS to get you home, you can mount this wireless charger pretty much anywhere. Perfectly adjustable, you can angle your phone in any direction assuring you the best view of the screen everywhere you mount it. ROBOQI can be mounted on dashboard, windshield and air vent on your car. Get the best driving experience with total hands free wireless charging.

 

 

ROBOQI is featured on

ROBOQI 1.0 Review

 

No need to worry about the grasp of the robotic arm, we tested it thousands of times to ensure its grip strength is enough to hold your phone even on bumpy road.

 

Charging & Driving on Windshield 

Universal Ball Rotation – Created with a universal rotary ball, you can mount this fast charging wireless charger virtually anywhere and rotate your phone into the perfect viewing position. Hang it down from the windshield or angle it up on your desktop. No matter where you put it, you’ll have an excellent view of the screen- thanks to the premium quality rotary ball.

What's in the Box

It took approximately one year from the initial idea to the final prototype. We were initially inspired by the movie Ironman and decided to combine the amazing Robotic style into our wireless charger. However, a perfect product takes thousands of abortive attempts. We tried to use an infrared sensor but then realized that it leads to excessive detection errors. This problem was finally solved by replacing the infrared sensor with a contact sensor on the surface. We believe our accurate detection technique will assure our customers with the best experience. 

Teams

We are an energetic team who loves creating innovative products to solve daily problems. Tony, the founder of this project, received his Mechanical Doctor’s degree in HKUST. He has more than 10 years of experience in electronic products. ROBOQI represents our passion for creating a product to be a part of your life. With your support, we can start mass production on ROBOQI and deliver them worldwide. 

For any questions please contact this email: hi@roboqi.com 

For more news, updates and more please follow us on:

www.invzible.com

Compatible Devices:

✔ 10W Fast Wireless Charging Model is compatible with Samsung Galaxy S9 Plus/S9/S8 Plus/S8/S7/S7 Edge; Note 9/ 8/7 ( Except for Huawei Mate 20 Pro, Google Pixel 3/Pixel 3 XL, LG V30/G7)

✔ 7.5W Fast Wireless Charging Model is only used for iPhone Xs/ Xs Max/ XR/ X/ 8/ 8 Plus

✔ 5W Standard Charging Model is compatible with Samsung S6/S6 edge, Note 5 and other Qi-enabled device like Nexus 4/5/6/7, Nokia Lumia 820/920/930/1020/1050/1520; Blackberry PRIV, LG G2/G3/G4/V10/V20, SONY Z3V/Z4V

✔ Huawei Mate 20 Pro, Google Pixel 3/ Pixel 3 XL, LG V30/G7 are at the 5W Qi spec that’s serves as the base Qi charging speed, so it is standard wireless charging at 5W/1A. Because they have original charger if you want to get the fastest wireless charging speeds when use those phones.

Please Note:

✔ About the car charger: Please connect QC 3.0 car charger in the box if your phone support fast charging, because Non-QC car charger and 2.4A or below car charger, USB Port don't support fast charging. 

✔ How to ensure strong adsorption of the suction cup? The bottom is washable suction cup and pad. Rinsing and air drying the suction cup and pad after using for a long time can restore their stickiness. We do not recommend to apply the suction cup on leather, wall or filmed glass surfaces as the suction cup is designed with strong viscosity and attraction.

✔ About the Phone case: Please remove metal ring holder, metal attachments and credit cards for optimal charging. Be sure your phone case is NOT thicker than 4mm (0.16 inches)

✔ Please make sure the phone center is at the wireless charging Inductive center. It will fail to charge if placed improperly.

✔ Preventing your phone from overheating: We suggest you close Apps to reduce power consumtion and turn off phone screen while wireless charging or you can move the phone near the cool air vent on car.

✔ About the air vent: Support horizontal and vertical air vent, Don't support round air vent.

 

Risks & Challenge

We have completed all testing and development. Our selected producers are ready to collaborate with us under our conditions and schedule. Your donations will cover the product expenses, packaging, assembly and shipping. We are committed to delivering the product on time with the highest quality. They are scheduled to deliver at the end of August.
