Le site qui rejoint FairPay devient un partenaire. En échange de son revenu, il
s’engage à n’afficher aucune publicité à l’utilisateur et à ne récolter aucune
donnée le concernant. FairPay se porte garant du respect de ces règles.Dans la pratique : il intègre un code à son site internet. Où va l'argent ?
La quasi-totalité de l’argent généré par ces abonnements
- soit 90 % - nourrit une cagnotte qui rémunère les partenaires mensuellement au
prorata de leur trafic.
Les 10 % restant vont au fonctionnement interne de
FairPay (transactions financières, infrastructures et salaires).Le financement participatif
La
création d’une campagne de financement participatif est un choix.
FairPay est un projet destiné à la communauté d’internet. C’est pour
cette raison que nous souhaitons lui donner la possibilité de se l’approprier
et de le faire exister. Et
puisqu’à travers FairPay nous avons l’ambition de donner plus d’indépendance
à l’utilisateur et au partenaire, il nous est impératif de conserver la nôtre.Nous avons
besoin de 50 000 dollars (car l'argent est collecté en dollars sur Indiegogo) pour faire l’acquisition d’infrastructures couteuses (des serveurs pour faire fonctionner le système informatique) et rémunérer des développeurs pour vous proposer ce qui suit :
Le point sur les contrepartiesÀ partir de 80 dollars de donation, vous entrez dans la Fresque FairPay. Vous devez vous demander où on vous envoie... C'est simple : le graphiste du team va designer un personnage inspiré de notre cher Michel Martin (la mascotte de FairPay) à votre effigie ! Et comme nous sommes infiniment reconnaissants envers vous, nous intégrerons ce personnage à un wall of fame en ligne qui, nous l'espérons, se transformera rapidement en foule de donateurs aux looks très très classes. C'est notre manière créative d'immortaliser l'importance que votre geste a dans l'histoire de FairPay.

story:
The Mu System...


Meet the Mu System - the world's thinnest international charger, brought to you from Made in Mind, the team that created the original UK folding charger. 



The Mu System is compatible with all makes and models of smartphone, tablets, MP3 players and pretty much all USB-charged devices. The Mu System consists of two parts: a power block with USB connector and separate plug attachments that are suitable for every socket type worldwide. Specifically: 






The Brit - pocket-sized and portable, this plug will reduce your overall UK plug size by over 70%. Say goodbye to bulky UK chargers!




The American - pocket-sized with fold-away pins, the streamlined design plugs flat against the socket and is the perfect travel companion.




The European - portable, with a 90 degree rotation , this plug head enables you to charge the products you love with a stylish twist.




The Aussie - down under travelling with a charger made easy with our smart, configurative design. It couldn't be simpler!


Simply swap on the plug head for the country you are in and plug in to the mains socket to charge your devices.


Why the Mu System...


The Mu System is a must-have for any frequent traveler. The design suits all lifestyles - it's small, light, and the components are easy to switch between. 



Buy the complete Mu System so that you always have the plug you need, wherever you are. 



If you don't travel, don't worry. You can buy the Mu with a single plug head of your choice and along with it comes our award-wining charging experience. Light, compact and stylish. And tiny!



How the Mu System works...


The Mu System has been designed to work with a simple, patented, click-on and click-off swapping of the plug heads. Ideal if you want a slimline, lightweight charger for day-to-day use, or if you need international variants to suit a travelling lifestyle. Simple, practical, beautiful.


UK & plug type G countries, including Hong Kong and the United Arab Emirates.


US & plug type A countries, including Japan, China, Saudi Arabia and Canada.



EU & plug type C countries, including China, Korea and South America.



AUS & plug type I countries, including Australasia, China and Argentina.



Features Overview...


The Mu System includes a 2.4Amp single port USB charger unit and an interchangeable plug head to adapt the charger to any country's socket type.





For high-quality performance, the Mu System also has an embedded auto-detect chip enabling the Mu to identify the device being connected and, in turn, deliver device-optimum charge. 



Compatibility...


• All smartphones, including iPhones and Android devices.
• All tablets, including iPads.
• MP3 players, including iPods.
• Most small USB-charged devices. 


Stretch Goals...



Our Rewards...


A short summary of our rewards are outlined below. For more information, please refer to the pledges on the right-hand side of our page. 





Our Story...


The Mu was the brainchild of Min-Kyu Choi. He experienced the problem of the UK plug size in 2009 while studying at the Royal College of Art when his laptop was scratched in his bag by its charger.

He started working on a solution.



With an initial sketch in hand, Min-Kyu joined forces with Matthew Judkins, a then recent graduate from Imperial College. Made in Mind was born and they set about moving the sketch forward and towards becoming a product.

The original, and UK-focused, Mu was released in 2012 and was an instant hit with design enthusiasts and gadget fans.

Since then, Min-Kyu and Matthew have been thinking about how to make their initial UK product useful in other countries.

The Mu System is the result...



Back to top


THE SMALL PRINT

What we need...


As you can see from our video, we have the design of the Mu System completed, the electronics certified, manufacturing in place and ready to go. Now we just need to create some bespoke tooling for the interchangeable parts of the Mu System and start production.

We hope to do this with your help. In exchange, we are offering some brilliant rewards at excellent value. 

But before we go, a note on one of our top rewards. As a start-up, we feel a real affinity with other new innovators - this is why we want to use this opportunity to get our product to other businesses that can use it as part of their merchandise. So look out for our 'fellow crowdfunders' award, from which we hope to build some great relationships. 


Risks & Challenges...


We have a great relationship with our American-based manufacturers in China, who have already successfully produced three lines of UK Mus for us and delivered to deadline, so we are confident that manufacturing risk is at a minimum.  

We are well versed in the challenges involved in delivery, so we hope our experience in delivering the UK-versions of our products will help us to make sure that your perks arrive on time and in mint condition.


What you'll get...


The Mu System will be available in two versions: either as a single plug attachment of your country choice or as a whole international line-up. Both will include the power pack, and all will be in black.

If all goes well, and if our crowdfunding target goes up, we hope to be able to introduce some exciting additional features. So watch this space for more news! 


Thank you for reading this far - let's make this happen!

story:
Short Summary

I’m Curtis Lewsey. Last winter Jeff Hanson and I met up at Panera Bread in Trumbull, CT to talk about some fun, new business ideas. One idea that came up was a concept to organize groups and communicate with them on a mobile device. This concept has now blossomed into a new App called FlashRe (FlashResponse). We have had a blast working on this project and are now taking it very seriously!

Background Story

  •  Jeff and I both graduated from Sacred Heart University where we also excelled at playing baseball. We founded the idea of FlashRe based on a personal need in our everyday lives. Jeff needs the FlashRe App to communicate with players and parents on the baseball teams he coaches. I personally need it to better communicate with family scattered across the US as well as for communicating with my business marketing team (across the world). 


  •  After running our idea by more and more people, it became clear that we are not the only ones who need this. We organized focus groups and asked, “If you have to send a message to 5, 10, 20 or more people at once, how do you do it?” Most said email and expressed its growing ineffectiveness. We then asked, “What if there was a way you could download a free app, organize all your groups, invite the friends you want into your groups, and have a quick and easy way to send messages via text, voice or video from your smart phone?” We also shared our interactive scheduling feature and from the overwhelming positive responses we knew we were onto something important. We knew we needed to create this App to make lives around the world a bit easier. 
  •  We have spent countless hours and a lot of our own money on this project, and are extremely close to its fruition. We are committed to making this a world-class app. We are currently working with six extremely talented full-time developers, four attorneys, and several consultants who have been added to our team. Helping us complete Phase II will push this project into Beta, which means that we can launch FlashRe to the world much sooner. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We only need $15,000 to complete Phase II and launch Beta. 
  • For contributing $50 or more to FlashRe you will have the ability to download the App and invite some friends onboard, to communicate with. 

Functionality

  • Our niche is “group mobile communication.” Are you (or someone you know) involved with a church group, PTA, Boy Scouts, sports teams, sororities or fraternities, book clubs, sales teams, etc? The FlashRe App is designed to make your life easier.


Other Ways You Can Help

•  We'd appreciate it if you would help us get the word out and make some noise about our FlashRe campaign. 

•  Indiegogo has tools so you can easily share this. Thank you so much :) 

                                  Click here to Like Us on Facebook

story:
Special spring offer! don't lose your chance! Final countdown!!!


JOIN THE IZEEE THANK YOU PROGRAM

Earn $10 Instant Refunds & Get Your iZeee For Free


Cables are horrible, additional batteries are bulky, you forget to charge them, you don't always carry them with you and your phone drains out of battery when you need it.

iZee can charge your phone or tablet with just touch of your fingers, absolutely anywhere and anytime!


iZeee blends into your phone by slipping under most soft cases 
so you will forget it’s there.


as your credit card, at only 1.3mm technological pad







FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS


Am I supposed to manually add shipping if I'm not in the US?

Yes, you have to add shipping on top of your selected perk. When you pledge, manually add an additional $10 to the price of the perk you want. We will do the matching at the end of the campaign.


Help! What do I do if I forget to pay for shipping?

No problem. Click the contribute now button at the top of the page and manually enter $10. It will be added to your pledge amount. Enter the same personal information you did on your initial order. We will do the matching ourselves at the end of the campaign.


I asked for my perk to be sent to the wrong address! What do I do?

We will be contacting all our contributors at the end of the campaign about their product choice. When we do, please respond and let us know the correct address where you would like your iZeee shipped.


When are you going to be shipping my iZeee?

Indiegogo isn't like Amazon or any other online store. When you contribute to iZeee you are funding all of our engineering, software, manufacturing and shipping. Everything that is needed to make a real product. Estimated national and international shipping date is December 2015.


Help! What do I do if I forget to pay for shipping?

The survey will be sent out 7 weeks prior to shipping and you will be able to pay then.


What if i have changed shipping address since i backed your project and i need it amended?

No problem,when the survey arrives you will be able to amend and verify the shipping address then.


How can i choose the color,connector size etc?

When the survey arrives you will be able to do it then.


Will iZeee give my phone a charge that will make it last for up to 4 hours?

It all depend on how much action will you make with your device. More action more power.

story:
Pepper’s Ghost

Exactly 150 years ago (1862) John Henry Pepper introduced a projection technique that is now known as ‘Pepper’s ghost’. This technique allowed live people or objects to appear on stage, like ghosts.
After 100 years, in the 1960’s, with the introduction of projectors, Uwe Maass and The Walt Disney Company further pioneered the techniques using the effect to thrill visitors in theme parks (Haunted Mansion), theaters and events.
Now 50 years later, we came up with the next step; bringing it to your living room.

Prototypes

We experimented with different materials and created two product lines; the mini holo@home for smartphones and the maxi holo@home for iPad and 10.1” tablets.
The first prototypes were made out of carton board. Although they work really good, the carton versions are time consuming to fold and the maxi carton version isn’t strong enough to hold a tablet. For this reason, we are going to make the final mini and maxi versions out of plastic.

Holographic content

I guess that it was hard to sell the first televisions, if there wasn’t any channel to look at. The same goes for the holo@home. We will setup a website to offer creators a place to share their content and user the possibility to find it.

Creating good holographic content is easy to do. We’ve been creating content for a long time and we put our experience into 10 golden rules for creating holographic content. Now it’s still in writing, but as soon as the holo@home is released, we will have a holographic tutorial (maybe the world’s first ;).

What we need

Creating the tooling for producing the plastic versions, the production of the first batch and the shipping is expensive. Although we do invest ourselfs, we run a bit short :(

We already gave a GO for the tooling (over 20.000 euro's). To be able to produce the initial batch and ship them to us, we need approx 30.000 euro's.

If you like our holo@home, please help us by telling others about this!

What you get

Depending on your perk, you will get our '10 golden rules for creating holographic content' manual, a holo@home mini, a holo@home maxi, or both. For companies, we will also offer a promotion pack of 10 holo@home mini's, 10 holo@home maxi's with personalised sides and their own 3D holographic logo.

story:
Privacy is a right

Privacy is a right.  Everyone, no matter, what race, what nationallity, what background has a right to privacy.  It doesn't matter where you live, what you do, how much money you have or don't have, privacy is a fundemental human right and in most places, it's the law.

I've designed Talaria, a mobile messaging system that is gauranteed private from prying eyes, all of them.  Not us, not anyone will be able to read your messages. Just you, and the people you send them to.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help.  We've built alot of this already, the system works, it's up and running today.  We know how we're going to put it onto Android, iPhone, Windows Phone and Blackberry and we've proven it'll work.  What we need now is help putting it onto your phone.

Firstly, we need to get it onto each device.  We've done the sums and think that'll cost between $10,000 to $20,000 per device.  That money isn't just spent building the app, we could do that for some of them, it's about making it easy to use by people who are good that & getting it tested so that you have a tool that protects your privacy & that you want to use.

Secondly, we need some cash to help run it.  It won't be ad-supported so while we're getting going we need to pay for the servers and the bandwidth.

As an early supporter you get the app for free, for life and depending on what you've donated you can give the app away for free too.

If we don't reach our funding goal we'll come back to you the supporters and ask you to vote on what platforms you want us to target first and see where we go from there.

How else can I help?

We need support, we want you & your friends to shout about our app, we want people to want to use it and that's about so much more than funding.

Talk to your friends about privacy, really think about what your privacy means to you.  Blog about it, tweet about it. 

If you're in the field of technical security, go to our blog at http://talariachatapp.wordpress.com and start peer reviewing our work.

Firstly, we need to get it onto each device.  We've done the sums and think that'll cost between $10,000 to $20,000 per device.  That money isn't just spent building the app, we could do that for some of them, it's about making it easy to use by people who are good that & getting it tested so that you have a tool that protects your privacy & that you want to use.
Secondly, we need some cash to help run it.  It won't be ad-supported so while we're getting going we need to pay for the servers and the bandwidth.
As an early supporter you get the app for free, for life and depending on what you've donated you can give the app away for free too.
If we don't reach our funding goal we'll come back to you the supporters and ask you to vote on what platforms you want us to target first and see where we go from there.


How else can I help?
We need support, we want you & your friends to shout about our app, we want people to want to use it and that's about so much more than funding.
Talk to your friends about privacy, really think about what your privacy means to you.  Blog about it, tweet about it. 
If you're in the field of technical security, go to our blog at http://talariachatapp.wordpress.com and start peer reviewing our work.

story:
Secure, Confidential Communication

It's hard to understand, with all of the data being collected about us all the time and the surveillance that has become pervasive throughout our online and cellphone experience, why we as citizens don't do something about it.

We have the technology. It exists. Today!

This campaign is about getting that technology into your hands, so that you can choose who to trust and who to communicate with in your own personal, secure, confidential network. We call it the Newbound Network.

The software is currently in a period of beta testing. This is version 1.0, and it's simple but powerful. The web browser based user interface allows you to easily establish direct peer-to-peer connections with any other device running the Newbound Network software. 

Works Where You Need It

The software runs on any Mac, Windows or Linux computer, and Android/iOS versions are in the works as well. It also works exceptionally well with small computers like the Raspberry Pi and the Phidgets SBC. Your help will allow us to return the decision of who to trust with your confidential information and communications back to you... where it belongs! 

Releasing to the General Public

With the software in beta, we have control over the way people are introduced to the software and how they familiarize themselves with it. In order to make that process frictionless enough for a public release of the Newbound Network, we need to spend some money to:

  • Produce documentation and contextual help
  • Fix any remaining bugs and implement features identified as "must have" by the beta testing team.
  • Set up a developer program with documentation and support.
  • Finish porting the software to Android and iOS (stretch goal).

In order to make your support of this great effort even more personally rewarding to you, we've come up with this list of incredible perks to entice you, including:

  • Early access to the Newbound Network software through the beta test program.
  • Enrollment in the Developer Program
  • Skype interviews with the exciting people making this software happen
  • If we reach our initial goal, we'll add the additional goal of finishing our ports to Android/iOs, and we'll add perks for early access to them.
If we do not reach our entire goal, we will not be able to release all of the Newbound Network apps to the general public on time, but we will at least maintain our beta test program until we are ready for general release.

What Can I do With the Newbound Network?

The Newbound Network is a framework for running HTML5 web apps in a distributed network, where the apps can communicate with each other across direct and secure peer-to-peer connections. Each app comes with a 5 user license so you can get started communicating safely and securely with others right away. The Newbound Network currently supports:

  • Email - Send email directly and securely from your outbox to the inbox of the intended recipient with no cloud company in the middle. No third party servers means there's no metadata and no back doors.

  • Push To Talk (VOIP) - Toaster Simple™ secure direct confidential audio between devices. 

  • File Sharing - Share files with anyone on the local network and with other devices you are connected to over the Newbound Network.

  • Port Forwarding - Toaster Simple™ secure private networking. Share your Desktop, printer, Minecraft server or anything else with an IP address and port number over the Newbound Network.

  • Developer Program - Build your own Newbound Network apps and collaborate with others on app development.

  • Distributed App Store - Download and update apps directly with the people you're connected to over a distributed app store.

More Apps...

Calling All Gamers!

Don't punch a security hole through your firewall in order to share your server! That leaves it exposed to the entire internet-- even the unfriendly parts. Share servers the safe and easy way using the Port Forwarding App on the Newbound Network. Ditch that voice server for the direct, encrypted peer-to-peer audio you get with the Push To Talk App! Get both with the Gamer Bundle!


Calling All Makers!

The Newbound Network is the perfect platform for your latest creation. Connect seamlessly to other devices with a direct, encrypted peer-to-peer connection... Access the built-in apps through the comprehensive JSON web services API... Control your new creation with a web browser! Join our Developer Program and get started hacking the Internet of Things!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Imagine a free "do-it-yourself" on-line platform where Architects & Designers showcase their uniqueness, partner with others and get clients. 

Short Summary

  • Any donation that you give will be used to promote you and your project pictures across Facebook, Twitter, Linked-In and others. For example, we will pay Facebook to 'boost posts' showing your pictures only, to reach out to a focused audience. So when others hear about you, they will hear about us. By doing this, when we have millions of followers, your future free posts will, by default, have millions of followers...making it a win-win.
  • Jaluk.com is an attempt to create a free-to-use 'open-source-like' collaboration platform for interior design and architecture. Design professionals and end users (clients) use the platform for shared learning. It attempts to greatly reduce inefficiencies in the industry. Users register for free and upload pictures of 'unique learning experiences' or post questions/problems for others to respond to. Users can contact each other openly, can collaborate on projects, professionals get clients, and clients or lovers of design learn from the collection of unique learning experiences. 
  • I am supported on this mission by others that I have met along my 18 year old career. I am an award winning entrepreneur who studied Architecture, focused on R&D of products and services in the building and construction industry. I am also an MBA plus a Chevening scholar from Oxford University, UK. I am passionate about introducing technology driven tools and processes which increases productivity and reduces inefficiencies in the industry. I am a big believer in the power of shared learning; I have authoured a book called "Smart Phones Dumb People?" and a regular speaker at educational institutions and industry events. 
  • Please feel free to ask any questions that you may have by emailing at jaluk@jaluk.com

What We Need & What You Get

  • The current format of jaluk.com is free to use, and we wish to keep it like this. We are doing this because we feel that an open approach will make life easier for clients and professionals alike. However the platform's success is dependent on getting a large number of professionals and design lovers to participate. The greater the participation, the greater the learning, and lesser the inefficiency. We need to promote the platform to get people to sign up free.

    We propose to use Facebook and social media in general for promoting jaluk.com due to its high user base, global reach and ability to target specific segments that we want to. Facebook marketing costs money and this is where you come in. Your contribution will go towards such promotion.
  • Here is the sweet spot. Your contribution will be used to promote your unique learning experiences only! For example, we will pay Facebook (from your contribution) to 'boost posts' featuring you/your projects only, to reach out to a focused audience. By doing this, when we have millions of followers, your future free posts will, by default, have millions of followers. In effect, you are not throwing money away....but you are buying (one time only) a highly focused promo (with a multiplier effect) for your own unique learning experiences...and a way for the world to know you and get you projects for free in the future. If people come to know you, they know about jaluk.com and its a win-win from Day 1. 

The Impact

  • Your contribution will have 2 direct impacts:
    a) It will promote you, and get you connections and assignments
    b) it will help create an 'open source' approach to global design

    Sharing is caring, and this has been shown across all sectors. Some of the most creative people ever born end up becoming architects or designers. In an open world, why not do the world some good by showcasing your unique talents instead of guarding it? Meet others like you and learn and grow together.

Risks & Challenges

  • The minor risk is the inability to reach the tipping point where any lover of designer wants to get on board the jaluk.com platform on his or her own....like the way everyone wants a Facebook account. Usually at the tipping point, generic growth takes over and the need for promotion funds reduces relatively. Till such time, we need to have enough funds to be able to push it across various forms of online media.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word: the world needs to know about this...so please tell your friends, family and colleagues.

  • Sign up free and contribute pictures: Sign up for free at Jaluk.com and contribute pictures of your unique learning learning experiences. Start a discussion on the discussion board or ask a question....let there be a buzz and get others to join in.Please feel free to ask any questions that you may have by emailing at jaluk@jaluk.com

story:
Our idea

Our idea is to enhance Google Glass battery life with a single push of a button. GAZERglass is a battery pack that extends your Google Glass power almost three times more than its original capacity.


What We Need & What You Get

We plan to attach Lithium-Polymer battery with the capacity of approximately 1500mAh to the left side of the Glass. It will be inserted into a plastic case with micro-USB output which will be used for re-charging; there will be an LED light indicating state of the battery charge and a button to start/stop charging.


Nicely braided cord will be coming out of the battery along with thin plastic holders preventing breakage of the cord. On the other side of the Glass you will connect to micro-USB input and leave it like that forever, because you will be able to transfer data through the GAZERglass battery as well as to charge your device. Thanks to the neat cord behind your neck - you will be able to take your glass off and keep them hanging on you when you don't use them


We have tested few batteries from different manufacturers and have chosen one we like the most. Circuit board protection for the battery was customized for our needs and we have schematic design and sample ready as well. Plastic case was printed on 3D printer, and we have internal and external model structure with sizes ready for production. The most expensive part of production will be making a mold for our plastic case. The second part is to make a mold for Li-Po battery. Third - production and packaging. When you open a package you will get a fully operational battery designed for use with Google Glass.


You can also use it to charge any mobile device that consumes about 5V & 0.5A (iPhone and Android).

Stretch goals

Our company was approved for a bank loan, but we are still somewhat short on funds. We are thankful to everyone who supports us.


Our story

Andrey is a GAZERglass idea creator. While we were working on Google Glass software he noticed that Glass’ battery life is too short to handle many activities that are offered to users. So Andrey had an idea to extend battery life, creating GAZERglass in his mind as a potentially great project.


Anton is Andrey’s friend, partner and co-founder of Worldintercom, Inc. He is working on GAZERglass project to make it attractive to the end user. Convenient, affordable, and perfect product is the main goal that Anton set for our team. His idea is to make GAZERglass a unique piece of art, that is harmoniously combined with Google Glass.


We also have Guli and Timur in our team. Guli is our General Manager responsible for customer service and public relations. She is ready to professionally assist anyone with any questions related to our products and services. Timur has genius skills in Search Engine Optimization, Internet Marketing, Social Media Advertisement, everything to organize successful promotion of our services and products to the IT market. He is the guy who will be posting news and updates about GAZERglass project on our website.


Design

In Moscow we worked together with the team of professional designers SMIRNOVDESIGN. Their view of a future product combined with a subject expertise produced beautiful GAZERglass battery concept.

We started with plasticine model and drew a few sketches,

then we worked on 3D model of a final object,

and finally 3D printed our first working prototype which you could also see on the video.


You are welcome to meet our designer team also.

Sergey is a president and founder of “SmirnovDesign”, company based in Moscow, which works on GAZERglass project design and architecture. His company is one of the leaders in an industrial design, cooperating together with Skolkovo Innovation Center.

Kirill and Ivan are the other team members who put a lot of efforts into the GAZERglass project. Kirill is responsible for styling, modeling and end product visualization; his ability to concentrate on task and get the job done leaves no doubts about success of any complicated idea that we might have. Ivan is a young talented designer and his responsibilities include general product concept, ergonomics, and composition. Ivan is very passionate about his projects and does the best for every project he works on.


Go green with GAZERglass

We are concerned about our environment and truly support an idea of plastic waste reduction. Our designers and engineers developed a very thin GAZERglass battery case to reduce plastic consumption.

Less plastic = more green!


Technical data & facts

Forecasted specs:
1500mAh Lithium-Polymer Battery Pack.
Simultaneous charging and data exchange via micro-USB

Lightweight and compact design. Convenient charging cable.
Only 3.5 ounces (100 grams)


Next steps

Here is some more information:

1. Our first step was to make 3D prototype of our design model.
That was accomplished back in September. We printed plastic case using 3D printer
in Moscow; then we bought a USB cable and attached it to our prototype. At the same time, Andrey was searching for a Li-Po battery manufacturers in China, and ordered samples from 3 companies.

2. We received samples when we came back to New York in October and this is when our next challenge begun.
We had to test those sample batteries in order to find out which one works better, holds more power, and doesn't get too hot during work process. After we were done with tests, we inserted battery inside the plastic case, soldered all wires, and finally got  everything that we need to charge Google Glass. This is when our functional prototype was born.

3. Currently we are looking for ways to fund our project.
We thought it might be a great experience to try Indiegogo as a way to raise funds. But we have also applied for a business loan and were approved. Surely we would prefer Indiegogo project to do well rather than using bank's money to avoid paying interest and endless fees.

4. Our next step will start when we go to China in 2014 (around 18-19th of January) to start manufacturing process.
We want to be on top of this process and stay in China (Shenzhen) for about 6 weeks in order to control quality of production. This is what is going to happen there:

a) creation of molds for battery itself and it's plastic case. This is done with the same manufacturer.
It will take 1 week. Approximate dates: January 20th-26th

b) production of battery and plastic case. Assembling all of them together with USB cable and other plastic parts. Testing process.
It will take 4 weeks. Approximate dates: January 27th - February 24th

c) production of battery package. This is done with another manufacturer in China.
It will take 2 weeks. Approximate dates: February 10th - February 24th

d) we will pack everything together. Ready to ship!
It will take 1 week. Approximate dates: February 24th - March 2nd

5. Final step is to deliver GAZERglass to the United States. Shipping by air and going through the customs won't take longer than a week, so we expect to have everything in our warehouse by March 9th. As soon as we get it, we will start sending battery packs to our early birds. After GAZERglass opening ceremony (around 20th of March) we will continue to ship batteries and will start regular sales in April.

Risks and challenges 

Our team is experienced in design, development, production and logistics of an end product. Our company is running for 2 years already, during which we successfully developed several hardware and software projects.

Of course there are always possibilities to be delayed at some point or to have an unforeseen expense, but we are bringing our experiences together with our partners and making a unique alliance which will prove itself. If any problems come up during the production cycle we will solve them using our own funds and resources. We will do our best to deliver GAZERglass on time.

Things you might be concerned about:

Design: our partners from Moscow, Russia created a beautiful and unique design of GAZERglass battery, so we have successfully overcame this challenge.

Prototype: 3D modeling and engineering of GAZERglass as a final product was a successfully completed task that ended with our real functioning prototype.

Product parts: we have tested few batteries from different manufacturers and have chosen one we like the most. Circuit board protection for the battery was customized for our needs.

Production: agreements were made with manufacturers and we are ready to start GAZERglass battery production.

Approximate dates: January 20th-26thb) production of battery and plastic case. Assembling all of them together with USB cable and other plastic parts. Testing process.It will take 4 weeks. Approximate dates: January 27th - February 24thc) production of battery package. This is done with another manufacturer in China. It will take 2 weeks. Approximate dates: February 10th - February 24thd) we will pack everything together. Ready to ship!It will take 1 week. Approximate dates: February 24th - March 2nd5. Final step is to deliver GAZERglass to the United States. Shipping by air and going through the customs won't take longer than a week, so we expect to have everything in our warehouse by March 9th. As soon as we get it, we will start sending battery packs to our early birds. After GAZERglass opening ceremony (around 20th of March) we will continue to ship batteries and will start regular sales in April.
Risks and challenges 


Our team is experienced in design, development, production and
 logistics of an end product. Our company is running for 2 years 
already, during which we successfully developed several hardware and 
software projects. 
Of course there are always possibilities to be delayed at some point 
or to have an unforeseen expense, but we are bringing our experiences 
together with our partners and making a unique alliance which will prove
 itself. If any problems come up during the production cycle we will 
solve them using our own funds and resources. We will do our best to 
deliver GAZERglass on time.
Things you might be concerned about:
Design: our partners from Moscow, Russia created a beautiful and 
unique design of GAZERglass battery, so we have successfully overcame 
this challenge.
Prototype: 3D modeling and engineering of GAZERglass as a final 
product was a successfully completed task that ended with our real 
functioning prototype.
Product parts: we have tested few batteries from different 
manufacturers and have chosen one we like the most. Circuit board 
protection for the battery was customized for our needs.
Production: agreements were made with manufacturers and we are ready to start GAZERglass battery production.

story:
Short Summary

We launched the LittleHoots mobile application on iPhone in May and since then, we've received resounding feedback to launch an Andriod version but we need your help.

The Impact

 Your contribution will help us raise our $5,000 goal so we can bring LittleHoots on Android to life in March 2015!  

Gift card for Keepsake Store:

Once the Android Keepsake Store launches, use your gift card to shop our huge variety of products including mugs, iPhone cases, canvas, cards, prints, metal wall hangings and ornaments!

LittleHoot printed on canvas:


Custom Illustrated LittleHoots Framed and Shipped:

This is a $325 value!
Meet the artist, Mr. Eric Disney, and learn more about custom memory tiles here:

http://www.littlehoots.com/custom-memory-tiles/

story:
YOU CAN STILL BACK THIS PROJECT!!

Although our Indiegogo has successfully ended with 125% of our goal raised
for a limited time you can still back it!

Just click here to select your perk







Make your videos..images...documents
INVISIBLE to others!

Even the HiddenToolbox program itself is invisible!
No program shortcuts, no icons, nothing! Like it doesn't exist.

Privacy is just the start:

This is where HiddenToolbox differs. It not only secures your files but more importantly unlike other privacy tools it also allows you to view, play & manage your files all inside it's own, private & hidden environment, which includes over 15 different tools. Files are never exposed to an unsecure area.

** Don't forget there is an option to remain anonymous when you back us **

Watch how it hides files

Platform:

HiddenToolbox is compatible with both 32 bit and 64 bit Windows computers from XP up to Windows 8. In the future we will be making a iOS version which will include tablet compatibility for Ipad and Android tablets, there is no current date for the iOS/Android edition, however we will ensure that all licenses work across all platforms, so if you purchase a lifetime license, it will work on other platforms when they are released.

Secures files stored on the cloud:

Use HiddenToolbox to secure files stored on the cloud. All or a selection of files can be secured. Access to the files will be instant with no decryption delays.

Perks: Regular vs Lifetime License

Our standard license lasts for 12 months which includes all of our online services, remote destruction, lost secret recovery, product updates etc, however just for Indiegogo backers we've made lifetime licenses available. These early bird limited quantity lifetime licenses mean you'll never have to pay the annual fee for our online services and you'll also get product upgrades for life! These exclusive licenses are only available to Indiegogo backers and will never be made available to the public. They are limited quantity and at just $40 they cost less than a one year license once the product is released!

Lifetime benefits:
  • Lifetime Product updates
  • Web based remote content destruction
  • Online lost combo key/Password retrieval
  • Full access to new future online features

 

Protect yourself

The HiddenToolbox can protect your files from:

  • Your spouse or partner
  • Your boss
  • Your mother!
  • Kids
  • Friends/visitors who want to use your computer
  • If you lose or have your computer stolen

It's ideal for individuals that want to protect their media from prying eyes, and corporations/professionals with sensitive information, Drs, lawyers etc.

Huge...Huge...MASSIVE..MONSTROUS list of features:

We've integrated a huge amount of features to give the toolbox suite amazing value, some of these features would cost you $30 to $50 each if you went out and bought individual software products, plus it gives you everything you need to perform all your important tasks in once place, with one piece of software, so need need to ever expose your files outside of the private environment.

  • All media and the program itself remain invisible
  • Full military grade encryption with instant file access
  • Built-in secure and secret media player
  • Supports all popular codecs: Play MPG, MP4, 3GP, WMV, AVI, Divx, flash etc
  • Built-in secure and secret super fast web browser
  • Remote self destruct - Very cool!
  • Content organizer - Organize media by keywords, tags, comments
  • Custom categories - Create your own categories
  • Search Engine - Find media fast. Search by keywords, tags, comments
  • View images in multiple formats, thumbnails, filmstrip or iphone style coverflow
  • User defined panic shut down buttons for instant shut down
  • Timer based auto shut down (Should you accidentally leave it open)
  • Video bookmarking makes it easy to go to favorite parts of any video
  • Create video and audio playlists
  • Import your web favorites
  • Pop up Blocker
  • File Shredder to make sure imported & deleted files can never be UNerased
  • Secret key recovery through a web based control panel
  • Store documents such as PDF, Word documents
  • Transcoder converts video files from one format to another

...It's FAST! Our proprietary encryption engine is FAST, we’ve developed an OTFE (On the fly encryption) system, so unlike other encryption programs which can take forever to playback, especially with large videos, our system suffers no delays, it’s all instant and delay free!

Hiddentoolbox is a Windows based high security product that not only makes your media invisible to others, it also uses a proprietary encryption system to ensure that it is also protected to militarily standards. As far as anybody is concerned the files simply do not exist on the computer, even the HiddenToolbox program itself is invisible, only you can access it through your secret keys and password.

It creates its own environment that allows you to not only secure all of your media but also organize and view it, along with lots and lots of tools for conversion of file types, a very fast secret web browser, media player and lots more.

There are other security products out there, but not one of them offers all of the tools in one place and that's a problem. It's imperative that you keep all your media inside the secure environment at all times especially when viewing it, protecting the media and also ensuring that you never leave a trace or any history.

No need to hide content? Content Organizer is still invaluable

Don't need to secure and hide your content, the content organizer is invaluable. Forget creating folder after folder and then struggling to find particular images, videos or documents. Finally you'll be able to tag all of your media with keywords, add comments, create custom categories to store them in, so your collection will once and for all make sense and media can be easily located. You can find a particular file based on its comments, file name, keywords, file type, using the somple to use built in search engine, this feature alone makes the software invaluable.

We've created a prototype GUI to layout all of the main features:

Prototype Content Organizer GUI

 

Secret Access:

You set up your own private combo access keys AND password to access the program, nobody knows it's there, it runs in complete stealth mode. As a critical component we have already developed this in order to ensure the project was feasible, it works extremely well, not only protecting against anybody on the computer knowing you are running the program, but also within a network.

Encrypt/Hidden Content:

Content is not only encrypted to military standards, but it's also hidden, it's literally invisible and can't be seen by anybody else, to others it simply does not exist! We have already developed this part as it was critical to the projects success, and it functions perfectly! Not only is the content invisible, but the HiddenToolbox software itself is also invisible!

Cloud Storage Protection:

You can also use it to protect the storage of your cloud based content by utilizing our encryption system to create one encrypted file which stores all of your media so that nobody else can read, great for cloud based storage like Dropbox etc...

Secret Browser:

A built in high performance web browser will allow you to browse the web without leaving a trace of your activity. We've created a lightweight test browser and we were blown away with the speed, it's exceptionally fast, out performing all the major browsers in download times! Plus it leaves absolutely no history behind.

Capture video and images from the web:

If you see a video or image on the web that you want to keep, just right click on it and it'll automatically capture and save it into your toolbox, even streaming videos, great for capturing tube videos when they are streamed to your computer, allowing you to build your own locally stored private collection.

Media Player:

There's absolutely no point securing media if you can't securely view it, this is where toolbox shines through. You won't have to take media out of the secure, secret environment, it has its own built in media player, play all your videos, view all your images inside the toolbox, with all major video formats supported MPG, MP4, 3GP, WMV, AVI, Divx, flash etc

Media Format Converter:

Convert image or videos into different formats. Ideal for converting large videos into smaller files for Ipad, Android Tablets, smartphones etc. All major codecs supported.

Emergency Remote Content Destruction!

Here's the cool bit, if you can't get to your computer you'll be able to log into a web based account, from another computer or smart phone, and instruct the toolbox to safely shred all of your content, and remove itself! All in the background, without anybody knowing! You'll even get a confirmation report back to your control panel to confirm its success.

Online Services

Various online services will be created, should you forget your secret key combo or password you will always be able to retrieve it through an online account. If you want to destroy content from a remote location you can also use your online account to send a self destruct instruction to your computer, you can also use it to move licenses from one computer to another.

Depending upon how much we raise we might be able to add other cool online services to help manage and connect with your content, more will be revealed as our fund increases.

Licenses

For the online services above, the software license includes an annual license fee. However, if you back us with the appropriate amount (Starting at just $40) we're going to give you a lifetime license so you will never pay any annual fees, it will also include free upgrades for life! This is only for indiegogo backers in limited quantities and will never be available after we complete the funding!

Where are we up to?

The project is almost complete!

We wanted to make sure that developing the project was possible, so we've already created the encryption system including the ability to hide all of the media and the program itself. We've created a prototype GUI and the content organizer, and we've also completed the web site and server code with it's ability to send the remote destruction control and all the necessary server functions for you to use it. We have a test browser in place, it's super fast, it just needs a small amount of development time to add a few bells and whistles. We've spent a lot of time getting this project as far as we can, and we're not too far off completion.

All the important features are therefore either complete or close to completion. We just need this last push to complete the final step of putting it all together and the development of some of the less complex tasks such as the media convertor, play list manager etc. So, please back us so that we can finish off these final tasks and you can be the one of the first people to get your hands on it.

Join The Rewards Program

Get Paid for Every Friend That You Refer!

Spread the word to your friends, use Facebook, Twitter, email etc

Get paid 25% of all the contributions from the people you refer

Click here to see how much you could earn

Click the button below to active the rewards program - It's free
Check how many backers you have referred
- Click on your name at the top -- My Contributions -- My Impact

 

 *** Indiegogo is not affiliated with the Rewards Program in anyway whatsoever.

 

Campaign keywords:

hiddentoolbox, hide, images, video, media, secure, secret, browser, organize, encryption, invisible, browser, transcoder, convert,mpg,avi,mpg,wmv,divx

story:
Death is an uncomfortable & painful subject for most people, but it’s a fact of life that we all face at some point.  Everyone grieves in their own way, but today, many of us may find ourselves turning to the world’s largest social network, Facebook, to share our pain and feelings surrounding death.

The My Respects Facebook Memorial Pages Application will allow you to create an interactive Memorial Page which will serve as a digital tribute and legacy for your loved ones, a deceased pet or even yourself.  These Memorial Pages are specifically designed to be interactive and wide reaching; encouraging family, friends and acquaintances around the world, to share their memories and feelings with other grievers, creating a respectful community of grievers facilitating understanding, communication and healing.

What happens when a Facebook user dies?

Facebook has over a billion users, and about 2.5 million of these users passed away last year. When a Facebook user passes away, a family member can request that their profile page be put in a memorial mode. The default memorial mode basically makes the profile inactive which makes it difficult for page visitors to view and interact on the deceased’s page.

Currently, Facebook isn't setup to deal with the death of its members with the sensitivity needed for this delicate issue. My Respects app will ultimate facilitate these issues.

What if someone you love dies?

Sooner or later we will lose someone you love and admire. One way to deal with loss and grief is to try to understand it. You may yourself turning to your existing social networks, like your Facebook friends and family. The My Respects Facebook App will help to create an online grieving community around the deceased individual, facilitating: friendships, sharing, respect and healing.

My Respects' aim is to provide a thoughtfully designed memorial app where mourners may share videos, music, photos, links, memories, and event details and much more. These items will help keep our deceased loved ones in our hearts and those that knew your loved one can visit the My Respects Memorial Page and keep their memory alive.

What if a Facebook user wants to set up their own My Respects Memorial Page?

When someone is anticipating the end of their own life, they are faced with many decisions. One of the most pressing issues can be how to say goodbye to their loved ones. With My Respects, you will be able to create your own memorial page, where you can do things such as posting a video to say farewell to the people in your life, or share your last thoughts, dreams, and wishes with the people you care most about. You will assign a digital caretaker to your account who will then be able to release your personal My Respects Memorial Page upon your passing.

What if a Guest Mourner visitor wants to do more?

Many visitors may find themselves wanting to do more when someone passes away. Upon visiting the memorial page the visitors will have the option of paying tribute in several ways. The visitor may leave a comment or story, upload a video or picture. In the future we look to have a group source feature that will allow for the planting of a tree in the name of the loved one who has passed on. 

The Memorial page creator will be able identify several charities which the page visitors will be able to easily donate to in the deceased person’s name. My Respects is excited to offer this option to users and hopes to benefit many charities worldwide.

Our Goal

We are raising 6,500.00 in  funds to finish the app development phase, which includes: interface design, functionality coding programming and beta testing.

Thanks for your support on this project! We look forward to this journey and celebration of life!

Our Awesome Gifts

Pledge $3 or more and get the "Forget-Me-Not" My Respects seed packet


Pledge $15 or more and get the My Respects lapel pin & a "Forget-Me-Not" seed packet


Pledge $50 or more & get a Limited Edition wood cut print of the My Respects heart, signed by Wes DeMarco & a "Forget-Me-Not" seed packet


Pledge $275 & get a Personalized etched pet monument & a "Forget-Me-Not" seed packet


Pledge $500 & get a set of limited edition My Respects monument bookends (2 pieces)


Pledge $1,000 or more & get a custom hand blown glass urn ETCHED


Sean Knight (43), originally from Upstate New York, has been designing interactive social media since 1995. As a youth he played goalie at an elite level of soccer. Later, through entrepreneurship, Sean experienced fashion design and marketing and branding.  Both honed his skills at working hard individually to achieve collective goals and demonstrated to him the power of a close knit community. He currently resides in a rural corner of the greater San Francisco bay bio-region.

My Respects was catalyzed by the death of a friend. There was no one place, virtual or otherwise, where all his friends could gather. The need for a space for their shared community to come together for expressions of grief, love and inspiration has blossomed into a online venue for all people to share.

do more when someone passes away. Upon visiting the memorial page the visitors
will have the option of paying tribute in several ways. The visitor may leave a
comment or story, upload a video or picture. In the future we look to have a
group source feature that will allow for the planting of a tree in the name of
the loved one who has passed on. 
The Memorial page creator will be able
identify several charities which the page visitors will be able to easily
donate to in the deceased person’s name. My Respects is excited to offer this
option to users and hopes to benefit many charities worldwide.
Our
Goal
We are raising 6,500.00 in  funds to finish the app
development phase, which includes: interface design, functionality coding programming and beta testing.



Thanks for your support on this project! We look forward to this
journey and celebration of life!
Our
Awesome Gifts
Pledge $3 or more and get the "Forget-Me-Not" My
Respects seed packet


Pledge $15 or more and get the My Respects lapel pin & a
"Forget-Me-Not" seed packet


Pledge $50 or more & get a Limited Edition wood cut print of
the My Respects heart, signed by Wes DeMarco & a "Forget-Me-Not"
seed packet


Pledge $275 & get a Personalized etched pet monument & a
"Forget-Me-Not" seed packet


Pledge $500 & get a set of limited edition My Respects
monument bookends (2 pieces)


Pledge $1,000 or more & get a custom hand blown glass urn
ETCHED


Sean Knight (43), originally from Upstate New York, has been
designing interactive social media since 1995. As a youth he played goalie at
an elite level of soccer. Later, through entrepreneurship, Sean experienced
fashion design and marketing and branding. 
Both honed his skills at working hard individually to achieve collective
goals and demonstrated to him the power of a close knit community. He currently
resides in a rural corner of the greater San Francisco bay bio-region.
My Respects was catalyzed by the death of a friend. There
was no one place, virtual or otherwise, where all his friends could gather. The
need for a space for their shared community to come together for expressions of
grief, love and inspiration has blossomed into a online venue for all people to
share.

story:
English   Français




   Our project in a few lines...


Gith is a free encrypted communication platform available on OS X, Windows and Linux.


Gith opens as a "Virtual Secured Desktop" and allows you to share e-mails, documents and chat with your contacts with complete end-to-end encryption.

You can also choose to store your documents on your Secured Cloud, your files are encrypted on your computer then transferred on our servers. 

Recent news urges us to develop smartphone versions and buy new servers ...



   Why do you need end to end encryption?



"End to end encryption" means that we use specific cryptographic mechanisms (asymmetric ciphers) to ensure that only the recipient of your message will be able to read it.

We simply transfer an «encrypted thing» to your contact and are totally unable to read its contents, we don’t even know if it’s an email or a document!

The same principle is used for your Secured Cloud : we store encrypted documents and only you have the key to access them.

This is definitively something you should use if you don't trust your usual services providers anymore.


   Our project history



We started our project from Paris one year ago, when no-one was thinking that general public privacy on the internet was a real problem. 

Nevertheless, we thought that anyone should be able - if needed - to communicate with a real confidentiality, for free and without any form of advertising.

This summer, documents leaked by E. Snowden have revealed several programs of the NSA showing clearly that all our communications are watched, analyzed and processed with the help of the major actors of the world wide web.

Most existing security solutions are based on the US and then cannot be fully trusted.

Today we realize that we should really put more effort on our project because the general public really needs a shiny, easy to use and really secure solution to communicate on the Internet.

That’s why we’re here, we need your support !



   What we need



Our project is actually in a beta-test phase for OS X, Windows and Linux and we own one server hosted in France

[download and try it from http://www.gith-systems.com/download/]

To propose you a real and complete solution we need to :
  • finish this beta-test
  • develop the iPhone and Android applications
  • rent new servers all around the world (not in the US, nor in UK ...) to be stronger and more flexible

You can help us to fund our hardware infrastructure (main servers, backup servers, databases), buy development devices for iPhone/Android versions, feed our Umpa Loompa specialized in computer security and cryptography.



   What you obtain!



Karma points:

We will not get more in details about all those Karma Point things. Everybody needs karma points, whatever it is. You’ll probably find them useful, one day.

By helping us, you get a lot of karma point, because you’re doing something right.

Quota upgrades:

Creating a Gith account if free and you can use email, instant messaging, documents and cloud features. A default Gith account has a 100Mb storage quota on our servers and there’s an annual fee to get more (20€ for 1Gb/year).

By helping us, we offer you increased storage quotas for your Gith account!

Smartphone Apps:

One of the biggest goal of this funding process is to develop earlier smartphone versions of Gith.

Once ready, they will be found on the Android Market and App Store for 5€.

By helping us, you will get them for free!



   The future


Computer security is a very large domain, with many old and wide US companies present for decades.

Those companies must be replaced by something else, something smaller, something more «independent» and something not subject to US laws and the «patriot act».

We’re a French startup, we’re experienced, we have ideas and convictions : help us protecting your communications!



   Notre projet en quelques lignes...


Gith est une plateforme de communications sécurisées sur Internet disponible pour Windows, Mac OS X et Linux


Gith démarre sous la forme d'un "Bureau Virtuel Sécurisé" et vous permet d'échanger des e-mails, des documents et de chatter avec vos contacts : tout cela avec du chiffrement de bout en bout.

Vous pouvez également conserver des documents votre Cloud Sécurisé, tous vos fichiers seront chiffrés sur votre ordinateur avant leur transmission à nos serveurs.

Les dernières actualités nous encouragent à accélérer le développement des versions smartphones et acheter de nouveaux serveurs …



   Pourquoi avez-vous besoin de chiffrement de bout en bout ?



Le "chiffrement de bout en bout" signifie que nous mettons en oeuvre des algorithmes particuliers (asymétriques) grâce auxquels seul votre destinataire pourra consulter votre message.

Nous nous contentons donc de transmettre "un truc chiffré" à votre contact et sommes totalement incapables d'en lire le contenu : nous ne savons même pas s'il s'agit d'un email ou d'un document !

Le même principe est utilisé pour votre Cloud Sécurisé : nous stockons des documents chiffrés et vous seul avez la clef pour y accéder.

C'est définitivement une solution technique que vous devez exiger si vous ne faites plus confiance aux hébergeurs traditionnels !


   Les origines du projet



Nous avons démarré notre projet en région parisienne il y a un an, à l'époque personne ne pensait que la protection de la vie privée sur internet était un réel problème.

Nous pensions néanmoins que chacun devait pouvoir, si besoin, communiquer avec une réelle confidentialité, gratuitement et sans bandeaux publicitaires "ciblés".

Cet été, les documents révélés par E. Snowden montrent que nos communications, celles de nos entreprises, sont surveillées, analysées et exploitées avec l'aide des principaux acteurs du Web.

La plupart des services que nous utilisons tous les jours sont des sociétés américaines et ne sont donc pas de confiance.

Aujourd'hui nous réalisons que nous devons mettre un effort supplémentaire sur notre projet car le grand public a réellement besoin d'une solution simple, transparente et facile à utiliser pour communiquer de façon sécurisée sur Internet.

C'est pour cette raison que nous sommes ici, nous avons besoin de votre soutien !



   Ce dont nous avons besoin



Gith est actuellement en béta-test sous Mac OS X, Windows et Linux et nous possédons un serveur hébergé en France.

[Téléchargez et essayez Gith depuis http://www.gith-systems.com/download/]

Pour proposer un service complet, nous devons :
  • finir la phase de béta-test
  • développer les versions iPhone et Android du logiciel
  • louer de nouveaux serveurs autour du monde (ni aux US, ni en Angleterre) pour être plus flexible et robuste

Vous pouvez nous aider à financer nos infrastructures (serveurs, serveurs de sauvegarde, bases de données), acheter des périphériques de développement pour les versions mobiles et nourrir nos Oompa Loompa spécialisés en sécurité informatique et cryptographie.



   Ce que vous obtenez !



Des points de Karma :

Nous ne détaillerons pas ici toute cette affaire de points de Karma : tout le monde en a besoin, peu importe ce que c'est. Vous les trouverez probablement utiles, un jour.

En nous aidant, vous gagnez des points de karma, car vous faites quelque chose de fondamentalement bon.

Augmentations de quota :

La création d'un compte Gith est gratuite et vous permet d'utiliser à volonté les fonctions mails, chat et cloud. Par défaut, un compte Gith possède 100 Mo de stockage sur nos serveurs et un abonnement permet d'augmenter ce volume (20€ par Go / an).

Si vous nous aidez, nous vous offrons des augmentations de quota pour votre compte Gith !

Applications pour smartphone :

Un des objectifs principaux de cette campagne est de financer et développer au plus vite les versions iPhone&Android de Gith.

Une fois prêtes, elles seront distribuées sur l'App Store (iPhone) et l'Android Market pour 5€.

Si vous nous soutenez, elle vous seront offertes !



   L'avenir


La sécurité informatique est un domaine très vaste, comportant de nombreuses sociétés US historiques, présentes depuis des dizaines d'années.

Ces sociétés doivent être remplacées par quelque chose d'autre, de plus petit, de plus "indépendant" et surtout, de quelque chose n'ayant pas à répondre au "Patriot Act".

Nous sommes une startup française, nous sommes expérimentés, nous avons des idées et des convictions : aidez nous à protéger vos communications !

story:
Imagine all your Mother's Day cards beautifully bound together. It would provide you an amazing place to look back and see how you've matured as a family over the years. Decade Card will give you just that, but not only for Mother's Day.

Decade Card replaces impersonal "regular" cards. It is a beautifully bound book that your family can exchange on any card-giving occasion. Your kids will create a new "card" for you by making an entry into their Decade Card. It will include photos, drawings and memories just for you. By the time your kids have grown up, your Decade Card will be filled with 10+ years of memories.

Need another reason to invest? Decade Card is a green solution to traditional "throw away" cards and your hubby can put the dollars he would've spent on all those cards towards your pressies!

Let us know which cover you prefer in the comments section:

Thanks for stopping by!!!
